loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 68 years old and married with nine children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Aida has borrowed and repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 33 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Aida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Gloria works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from vending vegetables. 

Gloria is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Grechen

texts.en:
Grechen is 23 years old and married with two children who are in school. Grechen works very hard to provide for them.

Grechen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, coffee, cream, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future Grechen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nogrina

texts.en:
Nogrina is married with five children. Nogrina is 46 years old and four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nogrina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nogrina requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. Nogrina has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Nogrina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Norain

texts.en:
Norain is 42 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Norain has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

Norain is borrowing 12000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
This is Miguela, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rhoan, a supervisor and a father to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Miguela operates an internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and social networks. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profit every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed for her business. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Miguela dreams to have a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Grechen Joy

texts.en:
Grechen Joy is 22 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

Grechen Joy has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Grechen Joy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
This time, for her seventh loan cycle, Diosdada is borrowing 11000 PHP to buy feed and medicine for her pigs. 

The food production business that she previously funded through Kiva partner NWTF continues and helps provide Diosdada and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Marieta works hard to support her family. She has a buying and selling egg business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dressed chicken (chicken that is ready for the oven) and from her general store. 

Marieta is borrowing 30000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional trays of eggs for her egg business to sell.

Marieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

Iluminada requested a 22000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Iluminada has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Iluminada would like to save money to expand her business. 

This is her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and married with three children. Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in it.

Victoria has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad. NWTF is listing Rosalinda's business profile for another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (cycle rickshaw/pedicab)

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 63 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Estelita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Estelita has been raising livestock for three years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional used quality clothing needed in his business.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita is 45 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. Isabelita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Isabelita has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like body lotion, pillows and other personal products.

Isabelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, pillows and other personal products.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. Leonora is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Leonora requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional inventory items to sell in her general store.

Leonora has been in this business for 16 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and corn.

In the future, Leonora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family. This is her third loan facilitated through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her general store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in her family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better business will be. More items available for sale will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Milagros hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.en:
Ni Luh lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has 2 children who are in school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a crop sales business.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  

Ni Luh is seeking a loan of 3 mill IDR from MUK to expand her business. With the loan, she will purchase more crops, such as banana, young coconut leaf, cacao etc.  She will sell to the market. With her earnings, she hopes to be able to pay school fees and fulfill her family daily needs.

loans.use: To purchase more crops, such as banana, young coconut leaf, cacao etc

loans.name: Lilanie

texts.en:
Lilanie is 56 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Lilanie is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Lilanie has been raising livestock for 7 years and also earns additional income from fishing and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 41 years old and married with seven children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, rice and other groceries.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from farming rice and a food vending business.

Jessica aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft drinks, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantsetseg is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Songinohairhan province, Mongolia. Her husband Erdenebat is a driver. Her three children, Solongo, Delgersaihan and Anhiluun, are ages twelve, seven and three. They go to the second-level school and kindergarten. 

Mrs. Gantsetseg started transportation service business in 2009 with her husband. In future, she is planning to buy a new micro-bus. Her car is broken and due to this her business is stopped now. She is asking for a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase a car in order to continue her transportation-providing business.

loans.use: To purchase a car in order to continue her transportation business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy scrap materials. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Teresita dreams that her junk shop will last and continue to grow. She wants her children to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She dreams of having her own car to drive someday. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a restaurant. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 37 years old and married with eight children.

Valerie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Valerie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling lumber.

Valerie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 55 years old and married with four children.  

Melodia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Melodia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melodia has been farming rice for five years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melodia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Juanita hopes that her business will continue to grow and sustain her daily expenses. She wants to have more profit in order to help her family more. She hopes that all her grandchildren will be able to finish their studies and have good lives once they settle down. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meetings as the sharing inspires her to be full of joy every day. She believes that having God as the center of her life helps a lot. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Catalina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an auto repair shop. Catalina is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store business.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
This is Lyra. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Lyra wants to be able to send all her children to school and to have them be able to finish their studies. She wants to renovate her house and to help her husband provide a good life for their family.  She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* meetings as it helps her to learn a lot from the Bible. The word of God strengthens her spiritual life. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela  de 36 años, es una madre soltera de 2 hijos de 5 y 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa rústica que el padre de Guisela construyó en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Guisela es una mujer ejemplar. Ella sola se encarga de educar y cuidar a sus 2 hijos desde hace 3 años. En todo ese tiempo empezó a trabajar con ahínco en el campo. Ella es agricultora. En parcelas que la comunidad le otorgó, cultiva carambola, yuca, maíz y plátanos. “Prefiero producir frutas, porque la cosecha es continua. Cada mes se cosecha carambolas y plátanos”, menciona.
Está satisfecha con la manera de su negocio. Cuando empezó tenía que trasladar sus frutos hasta los mercados, pero ahora, los mismo compradores la visitan. Eso gracias a la amabilidad y su buena capacidad de realizar negocios.
Esta vez solicita de su apoyo, para adquirir bolsas de fabono orgánicos; y así garantizar mejores cosechas para los meses siguientes. Éste es su préstamo número 3 con MFP. Por eso se compromete en pagar las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” y dice le agrada el trabajo con los socios.
Invertirá los 1000 soles en la compra de 10 bolsas de abono orgánicos, entre guano de corral y guano de isla, para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Guisela, age 36, is a single mother with two children (ages 5 and 4). They live in a basic home that Guisela’s father built in an indigenous community in the central jungle. Guisela is an exemplary woman. For the past three years, she alone has been responsible for taking care of her two children and providing them an education. It was also during this time that she began working in the fields. Guisela is a farmer. On plots of land provided by the community, she grows star fruit, cassava, corn, and bananas. “I prefer growing fruits because they can be harvested on a continuous basis. Each month I am able to harvest star fruit and bananas,” mentions Guisela. When she started out, Guisela had to transport the fruit to market. Now her customers come to her thanks to her friendliness and her keen ability to manage her business.

This time she is requesting assistance so that she can acquire sacks of organic compost. This will secure a better harvest in the upcoming months. Guisela is requesting her third loan from MFP and promises to submit her monthly payments on time. She is a part of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer de La Aldea” (New Dawn of the Village) and says that she enjoys working with the other members. Guisela will invest her loan of 1,000 PEN in the purchase of 10 sacks of organic compost, such as chicken manure and gull droppings, for her crops.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es:
Eduardo, necesita dinero para invertirlo en la agricultura, por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de 6 sacos de abono e insecticidas para la siembra, con esto podrá tener mejores cosechas ya que prevendra la maleza y las plagas.
El comenta que con el préstamo anterior aumento la producción de granos básicos y a mejorado sus gananciaa, y se encuentra muy bien con su familia logrando mantenerse estable económicamente.
texts.en:
Eduardo needs investment money for farming. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can purchase six sacks of compost and insecticides for his crops. With these supplies, he expects to achieve a better harvest by preventing diseases and pests.

Eduardo says that his previous loan helped him to increase his production of basic grains and improve his earnings. His family has done very well since he has been able to provide them with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of compost and insecticides.

loans.name: Abel Stalin

texts.es:
Abel es un joven de 21 años de edad, terminó la secundaria y es soltero. Vive en el cantón Pastaza ubicado en la Provincia con el mismo nombre, perteneciente a la Región Amazónica de la República del Ecuador. La cabecera cantonal es la ciudad del Puyo una ciudad ubicada en medio de la selva amazónica al occidente de la provincia de Pastaza y a 924 m. sobre el nivel del mar. Es demográficamente pequeña pero tiene una gran variedad de sitios que son los preferidos para turistas nacionales e internacionales sobre todo los de actividades ecológicas y de deportes extremos. Una ciudad que crece económicamente cada día por las actividades de comercio, ganadería, agricultura y turismo, por lo que en ella se han establecido sucursales de empresas financieras y comerciales que pretenden aprovechar la actividad económica que mantiene esta ciudad. 
Abel se dedica a la comercialización en su local de tienda de abastos que estableció hace 6 años gracias a la ayuda de su padre que le enseñó a desarrollar esta actividad. Invierte su tiempo todos los días al menos 6 horas. Abel siendo un joven emprendedor y  a pesar de los obstáculos económicos que se le han presentado; ahora desea incrementar su negocio comprando mercadería para diversificar los productos que ofrece, para lo cual acudió a la nueva agencia en el Puyo de Fundación Alternativa, en donde consiguió la agilidad y calidad de servicio que estaba buscando y solicitó el préstamo que requiere recibiendo además asesoría eficiente y oportuna para llevar a cabo la buena administración de su negocio y los recursos utilizados. Él está seguro que saldrá adelante y que será un proveedor reconocido en la zona.
texts.en:
Abel is a single young man who is 21 years of age. He finished his high school education. Abel lives in the canton of Pastaza in Pastaza Province, which is located in the Amazónica region of the Republic of Ecuador. The administrative seat of the canton is the city of Puyo, which is located in the middle of the Amazon rain forest and in the western part of Pastaza Province. The city lies 924 meters above sea level. This area is small in terms of population, but it has a wide variety of tourist sites that are favorites among domestic and international visitors. All types of activities take place here, ranging from eco-tours to extreme sports. Puyo is a city that is growing economically on a daily basis through its business activities that center on trade, ranching, agriculture, and tourism. For this reason, many financial and retail companies have established branch offices here so that they can take advantage of the steady level of economic activity.

Abel is in the retail trade and manages a supply depot that he established six years ago with the help of his father, who taught him this line of work. He invests at least six hours each day in his business. Despite being a young entrepreneur, Abel has been able to overcome the financial obstacles that have appeared along the way. Now he wants to expand his business by purchasing merchandise so that he can diversify the products that he offers. For this reason, he visited the newest office of Fundación Alternativa in Puyo in hopes of receiving good service and a prompt response. In order to submit his loan request, Abel is required to receive counseling on how to be efficient and timely so that he can manage his business well and make good use of his resources. He is confident that he can move forward and become one of the most well-known suppliers in the area.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his supply depot.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha de 39 años, convive con Alfredo con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa rústica pero propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Bertha es una mujer esmerada. Desde que tuvo a su primer hijo (a los 18 años), empezó a trabajar en el campo al lado de su pareja.
Ellos producen carambolas, plátanos y café. Sus terrenos de cultivos están dispersos. En su comunidad sólo pueden cultivar frutas, pero el café lo cuidan en zonas más altas.
“El cultivo de café es más sacrificado y requieren de más inversión, pero las ganancias son mejores”, cuenta.
La cosecha de café, la realiza una vez al año, mientras que las frutas, las cosecha hasta 3 veces al año, por eso continúa con sus labores.
Este mes es crucial para fertilizar sus cultivos de café y realizar la limpieza; por ello solicita de su apoyo para continuar con sus labores. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP. Menciona que pagará las cuotas mensuales con puntualidad. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de la Aldea” y se siente cómoda de tener socios responsables. Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de varias de bolsas de abono orgánicos, para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 39, is in a common-law relationship with Alfredo. They have five children, but only three of them (ages 16, 14, and 10) live at home. This family lives in a basic house of their own which is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle. Bertha is a conscientious woman. After she had her first child (which was 18 years ago), Bertha began working in the fields alongside her partner. They grow star fruit, bananas, and coffee. Their farmland is scattered in different places. They only grow fruit within their community, but the coffee is cultivated in areas with higher elevation. “Growing coffee requires great sacrifice and more investment, but the profits are much better,” says Bertha. Coffee is harvested once a year, while the fruit can be harvested three times a year. For this reason, her work is always continuous.

This month is crucial for fertilizing her coffee plants and removing weeds. Bertha is requesting assistance so that she can continue with her work. This will be her fourth loan with MFP. She states that she will submit her monthly payments on time. Bertha is part of the Communal Bank “Nuevo Amanecer de La Aldea” (New Dawn of the Village) and feels comfortable because her group has responsible members. She will invest her loan of 1,500 PEN in the purchase of several sacks of organic compost that she will apply on her coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic compost.

loans.name: Janobidin

texts.ru: Джанобидину 42 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, морковь и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его старший сын помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  7000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения и семена. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Janobidin is 42 years old and his is married with four children at home.  For more than 10 years he has been growing crops like potatoes, carrots, etc., and he makes his living by selling them in the market.  Since he has a high-quality crop yield, his products are in great demand.  His elder son helps him in his business.  With the goal of taking care of his family, Janobidin wants to increase his business, which means that he needs to achieve higher crop yields.  He is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.  Janobidin will use the income from this business to pay for his children's education and to improve their living conditions.  He needs and awaits your help.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru: Бахриддину 53 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и имеет более чем 10 лет опыта в бизнесе. Он занимается куплей продажей продукты питания. Он продает мороженные, шоколад, жвачки, колбасные изделия и т.п. Он должен срочно расширить свой ассортимент для того, чтобы привлечь клиентов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1800 долларов США для того, чтобы купить хлеб, масло, колбасные изделия, консервы, напитки и молочные продукты. Он надеется на вас и на вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahriddin is 53 years old and he is married with four children at home.  He is a very hard-working person and he has more than 10 years experience in his business, which is the purchase and sale of food products.  He sells ice cream, chocolate, chewing gum, sausage products, etc.  He urgently needs to expand his product offerings so he can attract clients.  He is asking for a loan of $1,800 US dollars to buy bread, butter, sausage products, conserves, drinks and dairy products.  He is counting on you and your kindness.

loans.use: To buy food items to sell

loans.name: Kiromiddin

texts.ru:
Киромиддин родился в 1989 году в районе Джиликул. Он живет с женой. У него двое детей. Киромиддин имеет среднее образование. 
У Киромиддина имеется небольшой участок земли, где он занимается садоводством и растениеводством. Киромиддин в основном занимается выращиванием бахчевых культур. Также у него имеется небольшой фруктовый сад. Киромидди берет кредит для внесения удобрений.
texts.en: Kiromiddin was born in 1989 in the Jilikul region.  He lives with his wife, he has two children and a high school education.  He has a small plot of land, where he works as a gardener and agriculturalist.  Kiromiddin mainly works at growing melons, as he also has a small fruit orchard.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayidote 30 Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE 30 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Hortense Mireille (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans et est mariée à un certain Boniface. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont trois restent à leur charge. Hortense Mireille et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Hortense Mireille a peu fréquenté l’école.  Il y a quinze ans environs que, Hortense Mireille mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (œufs, maïs) à son domicile. Hortense Mireille exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Hortense Mireille  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Hortense Mireille sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE 30. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Ayidote 30" is a group of 3 people, whose members all live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Hortense Mireille (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 45 years old and married to Boniface. The couple have 4 children who all go to, or have been to, school, 3 of whom are still in their charge. Hortense Mireille and her husband live together with their children and take care of the different household expenses together.

Hortense Mireille did not get much schooling. She has been selling various products (eggs, corn) at her home for about 15 years. She does her job passionately, which allows her to provide for her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Hortense Mireille is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of the "Ayidote 30" group. This loan will help them to better respond to customer demand and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and eggs.

loans.name: Tout Es Grâce 20 Group

texts.fr: TOUT ES GRÂCE 20 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Assiba Claudine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans.  Assiba Claudine est mariée à un certain Jean et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Assiba Claudine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Assiba Claudine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Assiba Claudine vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des produits cosmétiques et des eaux de toilette dans sa boutique. Assiba Claudine s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Assiba Claudine sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe TOUT ES GRÂCE 20. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
"Tout Es Grâce 20" is a group of 3 people, whose members all live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Assiba Claudine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 31 years old. She is married to Jean and has 2 dependent children who both go to school. Assiba Claudine lives together with her  husband and children and the couple both take care of the various household expenses.

Assiba Claudine left school at the secondary level. In order to cope with her various responsibilities, she has been selling beauty products and "eaux de toilette" in her shop for around 10 years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and with a view to increasing her capital and strengthening her business, Assiba Claudine is requesting a first loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the "Tout Es Grâce 20" group. This loan will help them to better respond to customer demand and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and "eaux de toilette".

loans.name: Mahougbe Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Félicité (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Félicité et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants.Félicité a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a près de quinze ans que Félicité vend des produits divers (maïs et charbon de bois) à son domicile. Félicité exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Félicité s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Félicité sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHOUGBE is a group made up of four members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group's representative, Félicité, is 36 years old and married.  She is the one raising her hand in the photo.

Félicité and her husband have three children, all in school and their dependents.  The couple live with their children and jointly take care of the various expenses associated with raising their family.

Félicité left school in first grade.  She has been selling various products (maize and charcoal), from her home for almost fifteen years.  She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children.  She buys her goods in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her capital, Félicité is requesting a second loan, along with the other members of the MAHOUGBE group.  Thanks to this loan, the group's members will be able to better meet their customers' expectations and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and maize.

loans.name: Segnon Group

texts.fr: SEGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Félicité (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans. Félicité  est mariée à un certain Patrice et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Félicité vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Félicité a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Félicité vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier de coiffure. Félicité s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Félicité sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe SEGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Segnon is a group of 3 people, whose members all live in the same district of Benin. The group's representative, Félicité (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 29 years old. She is married to Patrice and has 2 dependent children who both go to school. Félicité lives together with her husband and children. The couple both take care of the various household expenses.

Félicité left school at the secondary level. In order to cope with her various responsibilities, she has been selling hair extensions and beauty products in her hair salon for around 10 years. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and with a view to increasing her capital and strengthening her business, Félicité is requesting a 3rd loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the Segnon group. This loan will help them to better respond to customer demand and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and beauty products.

loans.name: Alma Corinne

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Alma Corinne est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 17ans et 13ans. Elle a un maquis où elle vend de différents mets et des boissons depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans les dépôts de SOBEBRA en boisson et dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra d'en tirer d'énormes profits et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: 41-year-old Alma Corinne is married and the mother of 2 children who both go to school. The eldest child is 17 years old and the youngest, 13. Alma Corinne has a restaurant where she has been selling various dishes and drinks for several years. She gets her supplies at the Sobebra drinks depots and at a market in Benin. In order to strengthen her capital and meet her customer's expectations, she has come to Finadev for a microloan. This loan will enable her to earn enormous profits and help her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy 15 cases of drink, 10 cases of frozen chicken and 20 quality dishes.

loans.name: Fifame Group

texts.fr: FIFAME est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Suzanne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Suzanne et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Suzanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Suzanne vend du riz et des condiments dans un marché du Bénin. Suzanne  exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Suzanne s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Suzanne sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe FIFAME. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Fifame is a group of 3 people, whose members all live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Suzanne (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 30 years old and married to Nicolas. The couple have 2 dependent children who both go to school. Suzanne and her husband live together with their children and they both take care of the children's various expenses.

Suzanne did not get any schooling. She has been selling rice and condiments at a market in Benin for nearly 15 years. She works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in Benin.

In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and with a view to increasing her capital, Suzanne is requesting a 3rd loan, together with the other members of the Fifame group. This loan will help them to better respond to their customer demand and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments.

loans.name: Mahutin 15 Group

texts.fr: MAHUTIN 15 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Grâce Islandes (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans et est mariée à un certain Salvator. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Grâce Islandes et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de l'enfant. Grâce Islandes a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a près de cinq ans que Grâce Islandes vend des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, conserves, sucres) dans son quartier. Grâce Islandes exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Grâce Islandes s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Appoline Verène sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN 15. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
MAHUTIN 15 is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood in Benin.  The group's representative, Grâce Islandes, is 27 years old and married to a man named Salvator.  She is also the person raising her hand in the photo.  Grâce Islandes and her husband have one child who goes to school and is their dependent.  They live with their child and jointly take care of the various expenses associated with raising him. 

Grâce Islandes left school in first grade.  She has been selling various goods (pasta, canned food, sugar) in her neighborhood for close to five years.  She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her child.  She buys her goods in Benin.

Eager to satisfy the needs of her customers, and to increase her working capital, Grâce Islandes is requesting a first loan, along with the other members of the MAHUTIN 15 group.  Thanks to this loan, the members of the group will be able to better meet their customers' expectations and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy various goods (pasta, canned food, sugar).

loans.name: Ayifa Group

texts.fr: AYIFA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Yvette Béatrice (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans.  Yvette Béatrice est mariée à un certain Isaac et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvette Béatrice vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Yvette Béatrice a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Yvette Béatrice vend depuis une dizaine d’année, du riz, du maïs et de l’huile végétale par le système de distribution. Yvette Béatrice s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Yvette Béatrice sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AYIFA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Ayifa is a group of three people who live in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Yvette Béatrice (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 29 years old. She is married to a man named Isaac and has two children, who are both at school and supported by them. Yvette Béatrice lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the various household expenses between them. Yvette Béatrice left school at primary level. In order to cover the various expenses, she has for the past ten years or so been selling rice, corn and vegetable oil through the distribution system. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand, increasing her working capital and boosting her business, Yvette Béatrice is, together with the other members of the Ayifa group, requesting a first loan from Alidé. This loan will be used to respond better to customer demand and to make more profits for themselves.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Nonvitcha Group

texts.fr: NONVITCHA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Hélène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Denis. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Hélène et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Hélène a arrêté l’école au cours primaire. Il y a près de sept ans que Hélène vend des produits divers (riz, huile végétale) et des tissus par le système de distribution. Hélène exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Hélène s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Hélène sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: Nonvitcha is a group of three people who live in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, Hélène (who has her hand raised in the photo), is 39 years old and married to a tailor named Denis. The couple has two children, who are both at school and supported by them. Hélène lives with her husband and children and they cover their children's various expenses between them. Hélène left school at primary level. For almost seven years she has been selling various products (rice, vegetable oil) and fabrics through the distribution system. She carries out her business with passion and this enables her to provide for her needs as well as those of her children. Hélène gets her supplies in Benin. With a view to satisfying customer demand and increasing her working capital, Hélène is, together with the other members of the Nonvitcha group, requesting a first loan from Alidé. This loan will be used to respond better to customer demand and to make more profits for themselves.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetable oil and fabrics.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is married and has three children. She has a well-stocked store that supplies her neighborhood. She says that she started with a small food counter, and then she decided to change her business and make a living through the store, which is going very well for her. She has good customers since she is friendly with them and all of her business' products are priced well.

Jackline is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, tea, noodles, pastries, and drinks. This will help her business to have a good stock and give her family what it needs. She describes herself as a hard-working person with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Edwige, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Edwige est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Achille. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edwige vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et assure ensemble avec lui les différentes charges de la maison. Edwige n‘a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis huit ans, Edwige exerce comme activité, la vente de friperies et de pommes fruits ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Edwige désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Edwige sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe NONVIGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: Nonvignon group is made up of three people who live in the same district in Benin. The representative of the group, whose name is Edwige, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from Alidé, with a view to increasing their business volume. Edwige is 30 years old and married to a man named Achille. The couple has three children, who are all at school and supported by them. Edwige lives with her husband and children, and the couple cover the various household expenses between them. Edwige did not attend school and for the past eight years she has been selling second-hand clothing and apples; this enables her to provide for her family's needs without too much difficulty. In order to satisfy customer demand more easily, Edwige would like to boost her stock and increase her business volume. To do this, she is, together with the other members of the Nonvignon group, requesting a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing and apples.

loans.name: Ablawa

texts.fr: Agée de 42ans, Ablawa est mariée et mère de sept enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 23ans et 3ans. Elle vend des produits vivriers et de divers depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Ne disposant pas de ressources nécessaires pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire la demande de ses clients, Ablawa a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ablawa is 42 years old, married and mother to seven children, all educated. The eldest is 23 years old and the youngest three. She has been selling food products, as well as a variety of other products, for some years and gets her supplies in one of the markets in Benin. As she does not have the necessary resources to boost her business and satisfy customer demand, Ablawa has requested and been granted a micro-loan from Finadev, so that she can maximise her profits and contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of corn and five sacks of beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, paint, etc.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Composé  de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe Benkan vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, de gingembre, pagnes wax, de pâte d’arachide et d’encens. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame MAIMOUNA en arrière (assise au milieu sur la photo) est la vendeuse de pagnes wax du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 pièces de pagnes wax de qualité différente.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame MAIMOUNA compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is made up of four married women, the majority of whom live in traditional families, and they average 32 years of age with two children each. They all live in the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region) and got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and marriage. 

The group members have small businesses selling ginger, "pagnes wax" (brightly coloured and highly decorative pieces of fabric), groundnut paste and incense. In order to increase their business, they joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third group loan.

Maimouna, sitting at the back in the middle of the photo, is the one who sells "pagnes wax" in the group. She is planning to use her loan to buy five sets of "pagnes wax" of varying qualities. She gets her supplies from wholesalers and sells on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, at home and in the market, to a mixed customer base. Maimouna expects to make and average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA with this loan and she will use it to reinvest in her business and help her husband out with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes wax".

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried coconut meat to sell.  Catalina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Catalina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling bread in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more bread to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dometilla

texts.en:
This is Dometilla, 69, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Pascual and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Dometilla operates a piggery. She earns by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 14,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her income as she expands the business.  

Dometilla hopes that her business will continue to be successful and dreams of giving her grandchildren a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed needed in her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 63 years old, married and has three children. 

Catalina is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Catalina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Catalina has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Catalina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Lucewin

texts.en:
Lucewin is 42 years old and married with five children.

Lucewin works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell at her store.

Lucewin has been in this business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lucewin aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell at her store.

loans.name: Oklunon We Lingbohotoche Group

texts.fr: OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTOCHE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la représentante (dont le doigt est levé sur la photo) se nomme Angèle Yénoukoumè. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même village. Ce groupe sollicite un premier crédit en vue de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d'augmenter leur chiffre d'affaire. Âgée de 47 ans, Angèle Yénoukoumè a peu fréquenté et est mariée à un certain Romuald. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Angèle Yénoukoumè vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a environs vingt ans que Angèle Yénoukoumè exerce comme activité, la vente de maïs, farine de manioc et de riz dans sa région. Ce qui lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté aux besoins familiaux. Angèle Yénoukoumè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Angèle Yénoukoumè et les autres membres du groupe OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTOCHE sollicitent un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu.
texts.en:
OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTOCHE is a group which comprises three members.  The group's representative, Angèle Yénoukoumè, is the one raising her hand in the photo. All members of the group live in the same village.  They are requesting their first loan, in order to raise the level of their activity and to boost their turnover.

Angèle Yénoukoumè is 47 years old and has attended school for a short period of time.  She is married to a man named Romuald, with whom she has two children, both in school and their dependents. 

Angèle Yénoukoumè lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the expenses of the family.  

Angèle Yénoukoumè has been selling maize, cassava flour and rice, in her region, for about twenty years.  This activity allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Angèle Yénoukoumè and the other members of the OKLUNON WE LINGBOHOTOCHE group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to expand their business and to boost their turnover and income.

loans.use: to buys sacks of maize, rice and cassava flour.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: Agée de 38ans, Liliane est mariée et mère de quatre enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 18ans et 8ans. Elle a une boulangerie qu'elle gère depuis quelques années. En vue d'acheter des sacs de farine de blé et de levin pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Liliane a fait recours au micro crédit de Finadev. Ce crédit lui permettra de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
38-year-old Liliane is married and the mother of 4 children who go to school. The eldest and youngest are 18 and 8 years old respectively.

Liliane owns a bakery which she has been running for several years. Liliane has come to Finadev for a microloan in order to buy bags of wheat flour and yeast so that she can strengthen her business and respond well to her customer demand. This loan will enable her to maximise her interest and help her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy 20 bags of wheat flour and 25 bags of yeast.

loans.name: Mahuklo 3 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même zone. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité et de faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe s'est rapproché de ALIDé, en vue de l'obtention d'un prêt. La représentante du groupe, Enagnon Yvonne (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 27 ans. Enagnon Yvonne est mariée à Alexis, un maçon et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé, et tous à leur charge. Enagnon Yvonne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison.Enagnon Yvonne a peu fréquenté l'école. Pour contribuer aux diverses charges de la maison, Enagnon Yvonne a commencé depuis dix ans la vente de tissus et parallèlement, la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité, tout en la diversifiant, Enagnon Yvonne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO 3, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
MAHUKLO 3 is a group made up of three members who all live in the same area.  In order to raise the level of their activity and to meet the demand of their customers, the members of this group have turned to ALIDé to obtain a loan.

The group's representative, Enagnon Yvonne, is 27 years old.  She is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to Alexis, a mason, and is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school.  Both children are the couple's dependents.

Enagnon Yvonne lives with her husband and children, and takes care of the various household expenses with her husband.  She has attended school for a short period of time.  In order to contribute to the various expenses of the family, she started selling fabrics (and additionally, kitchen utensils) ten years ago.  

In order to raise the level of her activity while diversifying her business, Enagnon Yvonne is requesting her first loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the MAHUKLO 3 group.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase styling products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new nail spa stations, a wax table for her salon, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory for her new line

loans.name: Zedaga 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ZEDAGA 1 est formé de trois personnes qui font le commerce des mêmes produits. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Natcha Viviane, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mariée à un certain Landry, Natcha Viviane est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les diverses charges de la maison. Natcha Viviane a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Natcha Viviane exerce comme activité, la vente des condiments dans un marché du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Natcha Viviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Natcha Viviane désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Natcha Viviane sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ZEDAGA 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
ZEDAGA 1 is a group made up of three people who sell the same products.  The group's representative, named Natcha Viviane, is the one raising her hand in the photo.

It is the first time that the members of this group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their activity.  

Married to a man named Landry, Natcha Viviane is the mother of three children, all in school and her dependents.  In addition to their children, the couple have another child in their care.  Natcha Viviane and her husband live with their children and jointly take care of the household expenses.

Natcha Viviane attended school for a short period of time only.  She has been selling condiments at a market in Benin for about ten years, an activity which allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She also stocks up at a market in Benin.

In order to better meet her customers' expectations, Natcha Viviane would like to strengthen and diversify her activity.  To do this, she and the other members of the ZEDAGA 1 group are requesting their first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de 4 femmes mariées, les membres de groupe DANAYA vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans la ville de Sikasso (3ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, des ustensiles de cuisines, bananes - ignames, glaces - jus et des fruits diverses. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégrés  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame AFOU en arrière (assise à gauche sur la photo) est la vendeuse de fruits du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une dizaine de paniers de bananes.
Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans producteurs et des grossistes et effectue ses  ventes en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et au marché, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Madame AFOU compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et aider son mari dans  certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The 4 female members of the Danaya group are married and mostly live in traditional family settings. They have an average age of 33 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other thanks to family and neighbourly relationships, and marriage. The group members are all small retailers, selling kitchen utensils, bananas, yams, ice, juice and various fruit. They decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Afou, on the left of the picture, sitting at the back, is the group member who sells fruit. She plans to use her loan to buy a dozen baskets of bananas. She gets her supplies from farmers and wholesalers and makes her sales, for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the market, to a retail clientèle composed mainly of women. Afou expects to make an average monthly profit of 22 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to help her husband with some of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Digna requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sardines, soap, shampoo, snack foods, etc.

Digna has been in this business for nine years now. In the future, Digna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKADI est constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28  ans, et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.  Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Le prêt antérieure a été bien dénoué.
AICHATA   1ère  debout à gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de fruits et légumes à dans ce groupe de femmes BENKADI. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt  des paniers  de fruits et légumes : bananes, oranges, tomate fraîche et aubergines.  Elle les revend au comptant à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de Sikasso et souvent au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The 5 female members of the Benkadi group are mostly married, with an average age of 28 and, on average, 3 children. They primarily live in polygamous family settings in Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso. They are on their second group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, in order to be able to satisfy their customers' needs. The previous loan was fully settled.

Aichata, standing on the left of the picture, is the Benkadi group member who sells fruit and vegetables. She plans to use her loan to buy baskets of fruits and vegetables; bananas, oranges, fresh tomatoes and aubergines. She resells them for cash to a clientèle composed of men and women. She gets her supplies from villages neighbouring the town of Sikasso and often at the Sikasso Grand Market. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 27 500 francs, part of which will be used to repay the loan and interest, whilst the rest is used to build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia, 47, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio and a mother to her five children. She, together with her husband, manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lucia operates a food stall. In the Philippines. The whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Lucia's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lucia hopes that her business will expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and a widow with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20.000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of firewood to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood business for 8 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Ms. Oyunchimeg is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Khuvsgul province, Mongolia. She has been operating a retail business selling of dairy products with her husband since 2000. They also sell organic pine nuts and fruits at the market during autumn. They purchase dairy products, pine nuts and fruits wholesale at a lower price and sell them at a higher price at the market.

 Last year they improved their building and warmed up using their business profit. Both their sons are to become university students this year. Ms. Oyunchimeg says, "We have to work harder to cover our sons' tuition and other expenses in order to let them become highly educated people." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to pay her sons' tuition fees at the university.

loans.use: To pay her sons' tuition fees at university

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 48 years old and has seven children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Letecia is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise.

Letecia has been raising livestock for four years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Redela

texts.en:
Redela works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Redela requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Redela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sari Makmur Group

texts.en:
With only 7 members left, the Sari Makmur Group are continuing their loan of 10,5M IDR and each receives 1,5M IDR. They decided to continue the loan until they have enough savings.

Ni Made plans to use her loan to purchase three superior piglets for fattening. According to her plan, the pigs will be ready to sell in the fifth month. The profit will be used to buy a sow. Ni Made has a plan to become a piglet seller, especially local pigs.

One of the members couldn't attend the meeting because of being sick. Ni Made is on the right, wearing a jeans jacket.

loans.use: To purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase sewing materials, equipment and supplies for her tailoring business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and from her rice retailing business.
