Il y a près de cinq ans que Charlotte vend des produits divers (riz, huile végétale, haricot) à son domicile. Charlotte exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Charlotte s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Charlotte sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe CERVEAU. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Cerveau is a group with three members, who all live in the same area in Benin. The group’s representative is called Charlotte, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. Charlotte is 37 years of age, and is married to Jonas. The couple has five children, all at school and under their care. Charlotte and her husband live together with their children, and ensure that the children are provided for. 

Charlotte stopped attending school during her high school studies. For almost five years she has worked selling various products (rice, vegetable oil, beans) from home. She is passionate about her business, and it allows her to provide for herself and for her children. 

Charlotte gets her supplies in Benin. As she wants to ensure customer satisfaction and increase her working capital, she has requested a fourth loan along with the other members of the Cerveau group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Irene Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Irene Azucena trabaja para una escuela pública en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 5 años como responsable de una escuela de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar, es madre soltera.

Actualmente es el segundo crédito que solicita a ceprodel para mejoras de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo y separación de cuartos y cocina con la compra de zinc, cemento, perlines y pago de mano de obra para otorgarle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Irene esta en su puesto de trabajo donde planifica y prepara las actividades para sus maestros a cargo de ejecutar las orientaciones
texts.en:
Irene Azucena has worked for a public school in the municipality of  Paz Centro for 5 years, as the responsible of the primary school. She is in charge of planning and preparing orientation activities for the teachers. With this job she has been able to provide her family with education, food and the other basic necessities. She is a single mother and has two children.  

Irene is requesting this loan to make improvements to her home. She wants to repair the roof and wants to change the separation of the rooms and the kitchen. In order to do this, she needs to purchase tiles, cement, beams and pay for the labor. This will allow her to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement and tiles.

loans.name: Felix Octavio

texts.es:
Félix, desea incrementar la mercadería en su negocio, por eso está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de productos de primera necesidad como maíz, frijol, azúcar, arroz, aceite, bebidas refrescantes, galletas y demás productos que necesita en su negocio para una mejor variación hacia sus clientes.
El considera que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a generar más ganancias ya que pudo abrir un nuevo negocio en otro municipio, y así ha logrado sostenerse mejor económicamente él y su familia.
texts.en:
Félix wants to increase the merchandise in his business. For this reason, he is applying for a new loan to purchase basic products such as corn, beans, sugar, rice, oil, soft drinks, crackers, and other products that he needs in his business in order to have a good variety for his customers.

He feels that the previous loan helped him to generate more earnings, since he was able to open a new business in another community, and thus he has succeeded in supporting himself and his family better financially.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, sugar, rice, oil, soft drinks, and crackers for his store.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en: Mr Bayarsaihan is 43 years old and lives with his wife and his 3 children in their own little house, in Hovd province in Mongolia. His wife works at the central hospital for the western part of Mongolia. 2 of his children study at university, and the younger one is a secondary school student. Mr.Bayarsaihan has been growing vegetables in his garden since 2010. He has also built a vegetable pit and bought 4 head of cattle this year. The production of milk per cow is 10 liters. He produces dairy products from the milk and sells them daily. He harvests grasses for his herd from the garden. He is a hardworking and sophisticated person. He is requesting 5,500,000 MNT to build a barn and to cover the expense of harvesting vegetables from his garden.

loans.use: To build a barn and to cover the expense of harvesting vegetables from his garden

loans.name: Henry Ely

texts.es:
Henry, necesita capital para invertirlo en su cultivo de maíz y de frijol, por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas para su cultivo y así asegurar su venta hacia sus clientes.
El nos comunica que el crédito anterior le ayudo en la compra de insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz y de frijol y con las ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia económicamente ahora están mejor.
texts.en:
Henry needs capital to invest in his corn and beans crop. Because of this, he is requesting a new loan that he will use in the purchase of fertilizer and herbicides for his crops. This will assure his sales to his clients.

His previous loan helped him purchase agricultural supplies for planting corn and beans. With his earnings he was able to help his family and they are now in a better financial situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julian, de 56 años es un hombre tímido. Vive en compañía de su esposa Rosa, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas: Milagros a quien cuida en la casa que heredaron hace 30 años. El trabajo que desarrolla Julian, es la herrería, tiene 25 años de experiencia en la fabricación de puertas, picos, lampas y demás instrumentos de la agricultura a base de metal. Gusta mucho de su profesión, pues es una herencia de sus abuelos ya que la mayoría de los habitantes de la zona se dedican a esa actividad. “Mi pueblo es la cuna de la herrería”, comenta. Tiene muchos clientes en las zonas aledañas, por lo que su trabajo es conocido y comercializado con mucha frecuencia. Ahora desea seguir teniendo las fuerzas para trabajar en la actividad que más le agrada. Asimismo seguir en la agricultura y crianza de animales como vacas, ya que es la otra actividad a la que dedica su tiempo. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio. Julian, invertirá el dinero en la compra de fierros para realizar los trabajos de herrería y si el dinero le alcanza sembrará alfalfa para el alimento de sus animales.
texts.en: Julian who is 56 years old, is a humble man.  He lives with his wife, Rosa.  They have 5 children but only live with one of them, Milagros, who they care for in the home they inherited 30 years ago.  Julian works as a blacksmith.  He has 25 years of experience making doors, picks, lamps and other metallic agricultural tools.  Julian really enjoys his profession; it was passed down to him from his grandparents.  The majority of the residents in his area make their livings in the same business.  He says, “My town is a blacksmith cradle.”  Julian has a lot of customers in the neighboring areas.  His work is well known and sells regularly.  Now he wants to continue to have the energy to work in the area that pleases him most.  He wants to keep working in agriculture and raising animals, like cattle, as well.  That's the other area he dedicates his time to.  This is Julian's fifth loan with MFP,  He is grateful for the opportunity to step forward that they offered him with his previous loans.  They helped him to improve his business, and so he promises to be punctual with his payments.  Julian will invest the money in the purchase of metal to keep working as a blacksmith, and if there is money left over, he will plant alfalfa to feed to his animals.

loans.use: to purchase metal to carry out his work as a blacksmith.

loans.name: Xiomara Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Elizabeth trabaja para una escuela en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 2 años como profesora de primaria, con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

Actualmente solicita un crédito para mejora de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo de la cocina con la compra de zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

En la foto Xiomara está rodeada de sus alumnos entre las edades de 12 – 14 años realizando un trabajo en grupo.
texts.en:
Xiomara Elizabeth has worked in a school in the municipality of Paz Centro for two years as a primary teacher. With this job she has been able to provide her family with education, food and the other necessities. Her family consists of her and her two children. 

She is currently requesting a loan to make improvements to her home. She wants to repair the roof and change the separation of the rooms and the kitchen. In order to do this, she needs to purchase tiles, cement, beams and pay for the labor. This provides a better quality of life for her children.

In the picture Xiomara is surrounded by her students of ages 12 to 14. They are doing a group assignment.

loans.use: compra de materiales de construcción zinc, cemento y otros

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Nora, de 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en una casa que heredó de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años brinda el servicio de cochera en el terreno amplio de su esposo, cobra por el cuidado de los carros de acuerdo a su tamaño, por su parte su esposo también trabaja en esta actividad, ya que el negocio requiere de cuidar de manera permanente  y por la calidad de servicio que brinda  han aumentado la cantidad nuevos clientes; que acuden a su depósito para mantener sus carros seguros, adicionalmente a esto vende también carne de carnero de las cuales ella misma los beneficia para venderlas en carne ya que así es más rentable. Pero lo que más le agrada, es realizar este servicio de cochera  porque le permite realizar de manera paralela otro negocio para generarse mejores rentas en bienestar de los suyos y su deseo es  mejorar las condiciones de su cochera para mejorar la calidad de su  servicio. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le ayudó a mejorar en su negocio. Nora, invertirá el dinero en la compra de calaminas para mejorar la infraestructura de su depósito de carros.
texts.en: 43-year-old Nora lives with her husband and her four children, whom she cares for in a house she inherited from her parents. For the past four years she has provided carport services on her husband's large plot of land. She charges for watching over the cars according to their size. On his part, her husband is also in this line of work, since the business requires permanent attention. Because of the quality service they provide, they have been gaining more new customers who come to their carport in order to keep their cars safe. In addition, she also sells mutton meat. She slaughters the animals herself for selling, which makes it more profitable. However, what she enjoys most is providing this carport service, because it allows her to run another business on the side, so that she can obtain better profits for her family's sake. Her wish is to improve her carport's conditions so she can provide higher quality services. This is her second loan with MFP and she gives thanks for the opportunity to make progress that she got from her previous loan. For that reason she pledges to make her repayments in a timely fashion, because this helped her improve her business. Nora will use the money to buy corrugated iron in order to improve the infrastructure of her carport.

loans.use: to purchase corrugated iron in order to improve the infrastructure of her carport.

loans.name: Rosa Elsa

texts.es:
Rosa, considera que los prestamos son una herramienta de trabajo, que le ayudan a incrementar sus ingresos en el trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de concentrado y mas cerdos para engordar y luego comercializarlos para seguir generando ganancias y manteniendo a su familia.
Ella manifiesta que con el préstamo anterior obtuvo más y mejores ganancias debido a que incremento sus cosechas de granos básicos, sus condiciones le han sido mejoradas, debido a que hoy su familia goza de una buena alimentación y facilidades de mejorar sus estudios y su negocio es mucho mas rentable.
texts.en:
Rosa believes that the loans are a work tool, that they help her increase income at work and this is why she’s requesting a new loan to buy feed and more pigs to fatten up for subsequent resale in order to continue earning profits and supporting her family.

She states that with the previous loan she obtained higher and better profits because she increased her basic grain crop yields; her living conditions have improved because now her family enjoys good nutrition and have better access to improve schooling.  Her business is much more profitable.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: Sayda, de 30 años es una mujer sería y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edgar y sus 4 hijos a los que cuida en su casa propia que compró hace 4 años. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano limpia las instalaciones de su centro de cuidado para niños menores de 4 años, para recibirlos y cuidarlos. Ella se dedica a muchas actividades durante el día pues su mayor esfuerzo se centra en salir adelante y mejorar económicamente. Junto a su esposo, que se dedica al oficio de albañil; siembran y crían animales. Ya cuando tiene un tiempo extra como mínimo 3 veces por semana, se dedican al trasporte con el motocarro que poseen, con el cual trasportan a los pobladores de su ciudad, hacia los alrededores, en esta actividad obtiene un dinero extra que les ayuda a cubrir los gastos diarios del hogar, por ese motivo siempre lo mantiene en buenas condiciones, “cada vez que necesito de algún dinero recurro a mi motocarro, pues las demás actividades, tiene su propio capital”, comenta. Este es el crédito número 5 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación, que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Sayda, invertirá el dinero en la compra de repuestos y el mantenimiento para su motocarro.
texts.en:
Sayda, 30, is a serious, hardworking woman.  She lives with her husband, Edgar, and their four children who she cares for in her own house she bought four years ago.  Every morning she cleans the installations in her day-care center for children under the age of four to receive them and care for them.  She does many activities during the day because her greatest effort is centered on getting ahead and improving economically.

Together with her husband, who works in construction, she also provides transportation in the motor vehicle she has; they use it to transport local residents to outlying areas.  She earns extra money doing this that helps her cover daily household expenses.  Because of this she keeps it in good operating condition.  “Every time I need money I turn to my motor vehicle because the other activities have their own capital,” she comments.  

This is her 5th MFP loan.  In all this time she’s been responsible and punctual but above all she enjoys being part of her association that’s composed of mutually supportive, enterprising people.  Sayda will use the money to buy spare parts and service her motor vehicle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service her vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cigarettes and pan making materials for their business

loans.name: Srwa's Group

texts.en:
Srwa is a 26 year old, young, married Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Srwa is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has 3 years experience working in her home based sewing and tailoring business. She would like to offer her customers a greater variety of services and better solutions to their needs. She would like to buy a sewing machine and also an A/C unit. To be able to pay for these purchases she is taking a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and also an A/C unit

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have additional family members. 

She sells charcoal and green bananas at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last eight years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation and to educate her children up to university. She lives in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas and bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Chinyavu

texts.en:
Chinyavu is 43 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband and her seven children in a rural village in Samburu. For 10 years Chinyavu has worked in her business selling charcoal.
Currently she has applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She hopes that by stocking her business she will increase her sales and her income, which she intends to use for improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar, a 33-year-old married man, has owned an auto repair shop in his town Agsu since 2007. He is the only provider for his family - his wife and two school-age daughters. With his family, he has to work hard and on an extra time basis to satisfy their needs.

Mukhtar has great demand in his shop. Thus, he wants to take a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy additional spare parts to offer good service to his customers. This is his first loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. Mukhtar is very thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts.

loans.name: Kwestan's Group

texts.en:
Kwestan is a 23 year old, young, married, Iraqi woman. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Kwestan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has two years experience with the small home based business activity. She would like to improve her work area and have a better work experience for a more pleasant time spent by the sewing machine as she creates custom ordered dresses and small household items. To pay for the renovation works she would like to take a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her work area and pay for its renovation

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Teachers from this institution, like their counterparts in other SMT operational areas, come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can buy or invest in things that their mere salaries do not let them buy or invest in. And at the end of each month, they repay SMT/Kiva lenders, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Tamba. Tamba is a 50 year old and a native of the Soa chiefdom. He is married and has five children who are attending school. Tamba has been a teacher for 28 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 39, is married and the mother of three children, ages 8 to 19. She lives in West Point.  Hawa has a table in the community where she has sold pepper, onion, vita, rice, palm oil, cooking oil, and many other items for the past five years. She makes a profit every day when she sells, because  her business is located where customers usually stop to buy as they pass through. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking oil, pepper, onion, rice and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, pepper, onion, rice and palm oil to increase her sales.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells vegetables and fruits at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works six days a week.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy passion fruit, watermelon, green bananas and tomatoes. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and farmer of fruits and vegetables to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit, watermelon, green bananas and tomatoes

loans.name: Moises Adalberto

texts.es:
Moisés, necesita capital para poder reparar su camión, por ello está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para la compra de llantas del camión, que necesita como fuente de trabajo así seguir con la fabricacion de ladrillo, transportandolo a los clientes, para ayudar económicamente a su familia.
El considera que gracias al préstamo anterior pudo mejorar su trabajo, adquirio materiales para fabricar ladrillos y bloques, gracias a ello ha podido mantenerse y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Moisés needs capital in order to repair his truck. He is requesting a new loan to purchase tires. His truck is a key element in his work, as it enables him to transport the bricks he produces to his clients, allowing him to provide for his family.
 
With his previous loan he purchased materials to produce bricks and cinder blocks. As a result, he has been able to maintain his home and has provided his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his truck.

loans.name: Luz Emilia

texts.es:
Luz Emilia trabaja para una escuela publica en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 7 años como sub - directora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos, brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

solicita a ceprodel un crédito  para mejorar su casa de habitación en la reparación del techo, del cuarto, con la compra de zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra, para darle una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

en la fotografia la Señora Luz se encentra en su puesto de trabajo donde planifica y supervisa las actividades de los maestros a cargo.
texts.en:
Luz Emilia has worked as an assistant principal at a public school in the municipality of La Paz Centro for seven years.  She’s raised her family composed of her and her two children this way providing them with schooling, food and other basic household needs.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a home improvement loan to repair the bedroom roof.  She will buy metal sheeting, roof purlins, nails and pay labor costs to provide better living conditions for her children.

In the photo, Luz is at her workplace where she plans and supervises the activities of the teachers in her charge.

loans.use: to buy building supplies like cement, roof purlins and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Cristina Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Cristina Margarita trabaja para una escuela en el municipio de la paz centro desde hace 39 años como profesora de primaria con lo que ha sacado adelante su familia quien la conforma ella y dos hijos brindándole estudio, alimentación y demás necesidades básicas de un hogar.

solicita a ceprodel un crédito para mejoras de su casa de habitación con reparación del techo de la cocina con la compra de zinc, perlines, clavos y pago de mano de obra para otorgarles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

En la foto Cristina está impartiendo clase a sus alumnos de primaria quienes están entre la edad de 12 – 14 años
texts.en:
Cristina Margarita has worked as an elementary school teacher in a school in the municipality of La Paz for 39 years.  She’s raised her family which is composed of her and her two children this way; she provided them with schooling, food and other basic household needs.

She’s asking Ceprodel for a home improvement loan to repair the kitchen roof.  She will buy metal sheeting, purlins, nails and pay labor costs to provide a better life for her children.

In the photo, Cristina is teaching her elementary school students who are between the ages of 12 to 14.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and others.

loans.name: Solomon Sahr's Group

texts.en:
This is a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu, Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city in Northern Sierra Leone to apply for a loan of 5,500,000.00 Leones. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 

Solomon is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Nimikoro town, near Koidu. Solomon is 42 years old and is married with four children, one in primary school and three in secondary school. Solomon has been a professional teacher for 13 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and use the balance to buy bags of cement and boards for building a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement and boards for building a dwelling house.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is 37 years old and live in Buchanan. She is married and has three children aged 12-21 that live at home and attend school. For fifteen years now she has been selling charcoal by the bag in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell. She hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 35-year-old married woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has four children, ages fifteen, thirteen, three, and ten months old. 

She has been in the fish vending business for five years. She sells fish. She plans to buy nylon fish net and more fish to sell. Her husband helps her in their daily needs by catching fish.

In the future, Lorna would like to expand her business to support her family and at the same time to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nylon fish net.

loans.name: Basira

texts.en: Basira is a 49-year-old mother of three sons. She alternates between household activities and working in her small business selling fruits and vegetables. Basira requested a loan in amount of 500 AZN to increase the capital of her business. Basira is grateful for the opportunity allowed through AqroInvest. She promises to complete repayments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to increase the capital of her fresh produce business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her son's milk selling business

loans.name: Humirzah

texts.en: Mr. Khumirzakh is 30 years old and lives with his wife, two daughters and his brother in a little house in the Bayan-Olgii province of Mongolia. His wife works at a private company. His daughters stay home. Mr. Khumirzah used to work at a private company. He quit his job because the salary was so low. He is starting his own business selling cars at the market. He is investing his savings in his new business. He will be purchasing cars from Capital city and reselling that at the local market at a higher price. Now he is requesting 3,200,000 MNT loan to make an additional investment in his new business. He is a responsible person with a good record in his bank account.

loans.use: To purchase cars to sell

loans.name: Abdulai's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present this group of secondary school teachers from Koidu Town, in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan. SMT/Kiva loans are designed for teachers and have proven to be very helpful to them. Usually, teachers’ salaries are small, making it impossible to invest their money on anything major. But with the help of these loans, they are now able to buy or invest in bigger things and, at the end of each month, repay the loans using their salaries. 

Tamba is the leader of this group of borrowers. A native of Wordu in Kono, Eastern Sierra Leone, Tamba is a husband and a father of two children who are attending primary school. Tamba has been a teacher for 35 years now. With the help of this loan, he is going to pay school fees for his children and buy building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails and cement for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as iron corrugated zincs, sand, nails and cement for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for her grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Moiwa Bockarie's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Like their counterparts in other regions of the country, these borrowers are going to use this loan for different purposes. Some will use it to pay school fees for their children; others will buy house-building materials, pieces of furniture, etc. And at the end of each month, they will repay their loan using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for making the deductions and repaying SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Moiwa is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Panguma in Eastern Sierra Leone 43 years ago, Moiwa is a husband and father of four children who are in college. Moiwa has been a professional teacher for 23 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Batdelger

texts.en: Mr. Batdelger, 32 years old, lives with his wife and children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They have two children: an 8-and a 3-year-old girl and boy. Batdelger is a skilled worker and works at a mining company, which is far from his hometown. At the moment, his wife doesn’t have a job, so she looks after the children at home. Until 2011, they lived in a rental house or in his parents' house. In the last year, Batdelger’s family bought a plot of land and has become “the real family” in the full meaning. Now, they are living in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent. The ger is built on the ground and doesn’t have a fundament (foundation), so in the winter it may be cold if they don’t have additional furnishings. Because the frozen land can cause a chill from below the ger, Batdelger is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to make a foundation and buy a thick layer of wool felt for his ger. By doing this, he and his family will be provided with good living conditions and overcome the winter’s cold days.

loans.use: To make a fundament and buy a thick layer of wool felt for his ger

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es:
Álvaro Antonio es soltero trabaja para un centro de salud  el municipio la paz centro como despachador de la farmacia desde hace 16 años,

 por primera vez solicita a ceprodel un crédito lo requiere para asumir gastos médicos como medicamentos y exámenes para la madre, ya que la tiene enferma y es el único hijo que la ayuda. espera poder ayudar a su madre para la recuperación de su salud y bienestar.

En la foto el Señor, Alvaro esta en su lugar de trabajo de donde despacha a los pacientes sus medicamentos.
texts.en:
Álvaro Antonio is single.  He has worked for 16 years as a pharmacy dispatcher for a health center in the town of La Paz Centro.

He's requesting his first loan from CEPRODEL.  He needs it to pay for medicine and tests for his mother.  She's sick and he's the only child who helps her.  He hopes to be able to help his mother recover her health and well-being.

In the photo,  Álvaro is in his workplace, where he gives patients their medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine and to pay for medical tests

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 6 hijos y vive en Morazan, Yoro. Doña María es muy trabajadora, anteriormente generaba ingresos haciendo trabajos de costura, luego quería obtener mayores ingresos y hace 5 años que decidió establecer un negocio de comidas. Ella elabora y vende comidas típicas y refrescos, pero su mayor demanda está en las baleadas (tortilla de harina rellena con frijoles, huevo, queso, crema y otros), estas baleadas las vende para el desayuno y cena. El negocio lo tiene en un puesto de venta comercial. 
Ella ha obtenido ya nueve créditos con ODEF y esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado. El préstamo actual es por 11,000 Lempiras que solicita para comprar más utensilios de cocina como ollas y freidoras para mejorar su negocio. Su meta es mantener siempre su negocio activo para generar ingresos y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
María, 50, is single due to widowhood.  She has six children and lives in Morazán, Yoro.  María is very hardworking.  She used to generate income doing sewing but wanted to earn higher income so five years ago decided to open a food business.  She makes and sells traditional food and soft-drinks but what’s most in demand is ‘baleadas’ (flour tortilla filled with beans, eggs, cheese, cream and others) that she sells for breakfast and dinner.  Her business is located in a commercial stand.

She’s had nine ODEF loans to date and is grateful for the support provided.  This current loan is for 11,000 Lempiras that she’ll use to buy more kitchen utensils like pots and pans to improve her business.  Her goal is to always keep her business active to generate income to help with her children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like a set of new pots and frying pans.

loans.name: Tito Obed

texts.es: Tito Obed, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero. Él es estudiante de la carrera universitaria de Contabilidad, lleva estudiando 4 años y sólo le faltan tres meses para terminar. Se ha esforzado mucho y gracias a sus padres ha podido estudiar sin contratiempos. Actualmente realiza sus prácticas profesionales. Le gustaría trabajar en el área de Auditoria Gubernamental. El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en el pago de sus estudios de ingles ya que es uno de los requisitos para concluir su carrera además considera que siempre es bueno saber otro idioma. Está agradecido con los inversionistas por la oportunidad que le van a brindar al apoyar su crédito.
texts.en: Tito Obed, 22, is single.  He’s studying accounting in the university and has been there for four years; he only has three months left to finish.  He’s worked hard and thanks to his parents he’s been able to study obstacle-free.  He’s currently doing his professional internship.  He’d like to work in the area of government auditing.  He will use the loan granted to pay for an English course because it’s one of the requirements to complete his career.  Besides, he believes that it’s always good to know another language.  He’s grateful to lenders for this opportunity he’s being given in support of his loan.

loans.use: to pay for an English course.

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a 37-year-old woman. She is divorced and raises two sons alone. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of products such as shampoo, soap, and detergents. She has four years of experience and has deep knowledge of market and demand of clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 150 AZN.  Her son helps to purchase the products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of a good location in the central bazaar of her home city. However, it is hard to cover the needs of two children, and Arzu would like to expand her business. 

She applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase more products and diversify her range of goods to cover her customers` demands. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase turnover.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 35 years old and lives in Buchanan. She’s married and has four children between the ages of 5 and 16. They are attending school and live at home, and her husband is a businessman. 

For the past eleven years, she has been into the pepper and bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable) business. She enjoys the buying because she makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper and bitter ball to resell. 

She hopes to build a house for her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper and bitter ball (an eggplant-like vegetable) to resell.

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en: Yusuf is a hard working person who is always on the lookout for new business opportunities. He has been selling charcoal for several years; thanks to his efforts and support from Yehu and Kiva, he was able to save money and start a meat-goat business. His current business is doing well and he wishes to invest more in it. However, he does not have enough capital to do so. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of KES 30,000 to buy more goats for sale at the market.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale at the market.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is a 42-year-old woman. She is a widow and raises two children alone. After her husband’s death, she was left without any financial support because she always was a housewife. This brave and very hardworking woman found strength to continue her life and start her own business. She owned money from her friends and relatives and opened her market. 

She is a market vendor now and has been selling different kinds of goods such as cookies, macaroni, ketchup, tea, and candies for the last ten years. Her shop is located in the central bazaar, which makes her business successful because a lot of people visit the bazaar during the day.

Her monthly income is 130 AZN, which is too little to cover the needs of her beloved children. To improve her financial situation, Naila decided to improve her business first. She applied for 1,500 AZN to purchase more food products and to diversify.

This will be her second loan. She has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to diversify her products and increase her income.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 26, is married with three children. They live in West Point. Her children are between the ages of 3 and 11. Because she lacks financial support, her children are not in school. Her husband is a contractor and he gave her the initial capital to start this business. She has been selling oranges, pineapples and cucumbers for the past six years. She makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods and helps with the expenses of her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oranges, pineapples, and cucumber for the business. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more oranges, pineapples, and cucumber for the business.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent, 30, lives with her family in her own house. She has a store where she sells coconuts. Her business is home-based. She’s had this business for four years and has acquired some very good experience, which has allowed her to make excellent financial gains.  Millicent is a very humble, diligent woman, dedicated to her work and ready to make her dreams come true. She works day to day to attain a prosperous future. Her biggest secret to attain the success she wants is perseverance and love of her work. She wants to open a vegetable stall. That’s why she is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy bananas, carrots, kale, tomatoes, onions, and other groceries. She is certain she can pay back the loan, and at the same time, she confides that she can take home some financial security.

loans.use: to buy bananas, carrots, kale, tomatoes, onions, among other groceries

loans.name: Ramatu K.

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org., based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Ramatu, a businesswoman in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. A native of Ninikoro in Koidu, the 33 year-old is married to a civil servant, and the couple has two children who are attending primary school.  Ramatu has been a businesswoman for 7 years now.  She sells dishes, buckets, spoons, plates, etc. She has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Leones in order to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy dishes, buckets, spoons, plates, etc. in bulk to add to her current ones

loans.name: Telesphore

texts.en: Telesphore is 28 years old. He is single. He is a motorcyclist and has been running this business for the period of four years. He is requesting a loan to buy another motorcycle to gain more earnings. The profit from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a very enterprising person who has always worked and is not afraid of challenges. His goal is to be able to continue growing and this way be able to continue helping his family. He has had a general store selling home products, a business he still runs. Since the previous loan, his living standards have improved gradually and he hopes to provide a better life to his family.

He's requesting the loan to buy supplies for his store, such as beverages, baked goods, flour, canned goods, sugar, and other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store, such as beverages, baked goods, flour, canned goods, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit has been engaged in food and household goods trading in Yerevan over 12 years. Anahit manages her business from her home. All her family’s members are involved in this business and, thanks to income from their business, they are able to provide for themselves.  Anahit buys merchandise for her business  from providers. She likes her family’s business very much and she has many regular customers.

Anahit and her family intend to develop their business by beginning khash production. Khash is a traditional Armenian soup, which is in popular demand during the cold season. Anahit and her family will sell khash as a frozen food.  Anahit is asking for $3,000 loan with which she will equip a room in her house for khash production. 

Anahit is 55 years old. She is married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. Her children are married but they all help their parents in business.  Part of business’s incomes goes to their families as well. This is Anahit’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to equip her house’s room for khash (Armenian traditional soup) production

loans.name: Redemtah

texts.en:
Redemtah, 36, lives in a suburban neighborhood in Samburu with her two children. For the last three years she’s been working in her own business; selling fuel. The business is profitable and she contributes her profits to cover family expenses.
 
The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy more gallons of fuel to keep her business well-stocked.  Her goal is to always be growing her business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase his stock by buying more items, e.g., drinks by the crate

loans.name: Asina

texts.en:
Asina is asking for a new loan so as to expand her existing business that has given her good results. She is a determined lady who seeks to move forward. With this loan, she will be able to buy another motorcycle taxi. 

Asina hopes to increase her income and open a retail shop in the near future. She has good credit references and she is sure to repay the debt as scheduled since she believes in faithfulness. She is grateful for the loans she is getting and she wishes to thank you in advance for your kind support.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 31 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and stopped her schooling at grade 8. She has three children between one and nine years old that live with her. 

For the past nine years Cecelia has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers and the profit she generates helps her buy food for her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes (ie. plates, bowls, etc.) for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
Lizeth es una joven madre de 35 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo en la localidad de San Carlos, Costa Rica. Con mucho esfuerzo ella y su esposo comenzaron a construir su casa, no la han podido terminar por falta de recursos económicos, deben concluir los laterales del techo por donde entra la lluvia constantemente ya que el pais esta en la época de invierno, a Lizeth le preocupa esta situación  ya que afecta la salud de sus hijos, también deben poner cielo raso, mejorar parte del piso que se ha deteriorado y pintar paredes entre otras cosas.  Por esta razón está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar materiales de construcción y pagar mano de obra y de esta manera poder terminar su vivienda.
Ella agradece la oportunidad de obtener crédito rápido y de cuotas a su alcance.
texts.en:
Lizeth, 35, is a young mother of two children; she lives with her husband in San Carlos, Costa Rica.  With much effort she and her husband started to build their house but have been unable to finish it for lack of economic resources.  They must finish the sides of the roof because rain leaks in constantly because this is winter season.  

Lizeth is concerned about this situation because it affects her children’s health.  They must also install ceilings, repair flooring that’s worn out and paint walls, among other things.  

This is why she’s asking for a one-million colon loan to buy building materials and to pay labor costs to finish her house.  She is grateful for the opportunity to get quick credit with payment terms she can afford.

loans.use: to buy building materials ad paint to finish the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Ada Julia

texts.es:
Ada, originaria de la comunidad Santo Cristo, en las afueras de León, se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, actividad que ha desarrollado durante  años, como una forma de obtener ingresos para apoyar a su familia. Esta actividad la ha permitido crecer poco a poco como comerciante y sobre todo pagarles educación a sus hijos. El financiamiento para la compra de animales ha sido clave en su camino a lograr sus metas. 
En esta ocasión está requiriendo un crédito para comprar cerdos y alimentos para engordarlos. Pues no pierde su meta de lograr tener una granja de cerdos de raza.
texts.en: Ada is from the community of Santo Cristo in the outskirts of León.  She raises pigs to sell, an activity she’s been developing over years as a way of generating income to help support her family.  This activity has made it possible for her to gradually grow as a merchant and above all to pay for her children’s schooling.  Financing to buy animals has been key for her along the road to reach her goals.  On this occasion she needs a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up with because she does not lose sight of her goal which is to have a large farm to raise pedigree pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them up with.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Мамлакат  жизнерадостная пожилая женщина.  Замужем, имеет пятерых  детей.  Она уже в возрасте но не сидит сложа руки. Мамлакат   занимается животноводством  уже десять лет . Знает все преимущество в этом деле.  Муж её  работает мастером по ремонту помещений. Сын её занимается выращиванием овощей (огурцы, помидоры) . Но хороший доход у этой семьи от откармливании скота.  Поэтому они планируют развивать эту деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота. На полученный кредит Мамлакат планирует купить крупно рогатый скот. Заранее благодарит за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamlakat is a cheerful middle-aged woman. She is married with five children. She remains active despite her age.
Mamlakat has been raising livestock for ten years. She knows all the tricks of this trade. Her husband repairs buildings. Her son grows vegetables -- cucumbers and tomatoes. But the family's largest source of income is fattening livestock, so they plan to grow this business further and increase their headcount. Mamlakat plans to buy cattle with her loan. She thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 29 años , actualmente convive con su pareja, Máximo conjuntamente con la pequeña Madeleine de 7 añitos , conformando un hogar que habita en una casa propia hecha a base de adobe . Su oficio desde hace ya 8 años abarca el rubro de la tienda de abarrotes que logro habilitar en el primer piso de  su domicilio con el apoyo de su pareja y desde entonces ha tenido una muy buena acogida entre los vecinos del lugar, generando así buenos ingresos para el hogar. Considera que el estar en su negocio le permite no perder constante comunicación con su hija pues justamente ella fue unos de los motivos para la apertura de su tienda , no obstante el retraso en la entrega de productos por parte de sus proveedores le generan grandes inconvenientes debido a que pierde clientela constantemente , por ello considera que en adelante la mejor manera de contrarrestarlo es con la compra de productos y víveres no perecibles al por mayor para así tener una mejor reserva.  Para Edith este es su préstamo número 09 con la cual se siente confiada y agradecida para el cumplimiento de sus pagos , considera también que el trabajo en su banco comunal es mas efectivo debido a que a ella le genera confianza en todo aspecto.
Con los 2,000 planea comprar sacos de arroz, conservas y  cereales. Con ello poder tener suficiente reserva para así evitar que el retraso de su proveedor la perjudique a ella y a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edith, 29, is living with her spouse, Máximo, and their little 7-year-old girl, Madeleine forming a home living in their own adobe house.  For the last 8 years she’s been a grocer.  She was able to set aside the ground floor of her house as a grocery store with support from her spouse and since then has been very well received by local neighbors generating good household income.

She believes that being able to be in her store allows her to keep in constant contact with her daughter since she was one of the motivating forces behind her opening the store.  Nevertheless, delays in product delivery from some of her suppliers cause problems because she constantly loses customers.  Because of this she believes that the best way to counteract this is by purchasing products and non-perishable foodstuffs at wholesale in order to have a better reserve.  

For Edith, this is her 9th loan.  With it she feels confident and grateful to make her payments.  She also considers that work in her communal bank is more effective because it inspires confidence in her in all respects.  She plans to use the 2,000 to buy sacks of rice, canned goods and cereals to have enough in reserve to avoid supply delays that harm her and her customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, canned goods and cereals.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos, además de dar clases pues es profesora de profesión, sus hijos tiene 7 y 14 años de edad están estudiando. Su negocio lo empezó por medio de una amiga que le consiguió clientela y le sugirió que vendiera ropa con facilidades de pago, así los hizo y noto que le generaba mejores ingresos. Ella desea poner una gran tienda para dedicarse a vender por completo ropa y mercadería variada. Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar zapatos, ropa y bolsos para damas, pues tiene encargos que cumplir y sus clientes siempre están en busca de variedad y estilos con precios accesibles.
texts.en: Ana, 40, sells clothes and shoes; she also teaches because that’s her profession.  Her children are 7 and 14 years of age and are attending school.  She started her business through a girlfriend who got her customers and suggested she sell clothes with easy payment plans.  She did so and noted that it generated higher income.  She wants to open a large store in order to sell clothes and varied merchandise.  She needs the loan to buy shoes, clothes and women’s purses because she has pending orders to fill and her customers are always on the lookout for variety and style at affordable prices.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothes and women's purses.

loans.name: Juana De La Trinidad

texts.es:
Juana, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos, los cuales viven independiente. Ella habita en la ciudad de León, se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos. Tenía 25 años cuando hizo sus primeras ventas, pues trabajaba en un hospital, sus clientes eran sus compañeros de trabajo a quienes les vendía zapatos. Desde entonces se dedica a trabajar en el comercio, también vende cosméticos. 
La temporada de navidad se acerca y desea comprar mercadería de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos para vender y aprovechar los precios que están bajos ya que en diciembre suben. Sus clientes les encantan la variedad en mercadería que ella ofrece. Uno de sus sueños es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para lograr poner una mini tienda de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, en donde sus clientes se sientan a gusto comprando sus artículos.
texts.en:
Juana is a single mother. She has three children, who live independently. She lives in the city of León, selling clothing and shoes. She was 25 years old when she made her first sales. She worked in a hospital and her customers were her coworkers to whom she sold shoes. Since then she has been working in commerce, also selling cosmetics. 

The Christmas season is approaching and she wants to buy merchandise of clothing, shoes and cosmetics to sell and to take  advantage of prices that are low since they climb during December.

Her customers like the variety of merchandise that she offers. One of her dreams is to improve the infrastructure of her home in order to put in a mini-store of clothing, shoes and cosmetics where her clients feel comfortable buying their merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics in advance of the Christmas season to sell in her business.

loans.name: Nabat

texts.en:
Nabat is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She is classified as an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in an IDP settlement. She is a farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. People in Azerbaijan use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits adorn every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch.  

Nabat’s spouse helps her with the business because raising crops takes a lot of strength and work in the open air, which is very hard. She has been doing this for 16 years, and that makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. Her monthly income is 600 AZN. She usually sells her crops from her house. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers as well as new garden tools. This will allow her to improve the quality of her products and increase her monthly revenue.  For this purpose she has applied for 2000 AZN.  This will be her third loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and new garden tools

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 40-year-old widowed woman who owns rental houses. She is a visionary woman who always thinks big. In addition to having rental houses, she also owns a cereal-grinding machine. She is happy now that the job is stress-free as she waits until month-end to collect money. The challenge she faces is that some of her tenants are reluctant to pay on time. 

Dorcas wants to expand one of her rental houses and build another room. She however does not have enough money to buy the materials. She is asking Yehu for a loan so as to buy cement, blocks, and other building materials.

loans.use: buy cement, blocks, and other building materials.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Salina is a married lady, aged 54 years old. She is blessed with five children aged 34, 30, 26, 20 and 15 years old. She operates a 'posho' (cornmeal) mill in the Manjengo area of Narok town, and has been running the business for 18 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.


She has borrowed a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more cereals for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay college fees for her last-born child. Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Prisciila

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married lady, aged 35 years.  She is blessed with five children between two to 12 years old. She operates a retail shop in Narok town and has been running the business for six years, earning a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

She has borrowed her first loan of KES.15,000 from KADET LTD., with which she will purchase assorted cereals for additional income above the income from her retail shop. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-aged children.

Her dream is to improve her living standards and own her residential plot

loans.use: to purchase assorted  cereals

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 30 years old and married to Rose.  They are not yet blessed with children.  He runs a spare parts shop where he sells motor vehicle spare parts and bicycle parts. He started this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

He has requested  a first loan of KES.30,000 to purchase motor vehicle and bicycle spare parts to sell. Any profit will aid him expand this business. His dream is to see this business grow from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase a motor vehicle and bicycle spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena, 31, is single with a child who is ten years old and is in school. Helena stopped her education in the 7th grade. She is a hard-working mother who  has been managing her business for the past five years in order to meet the needs of her child.  

She has been selling body cream, ladies' spray, hair grease, hand cream, and men's spray in the market. Because of the good interaction with her  customers, she makes a profit. With the profit she is able to buy more goods and attend to the needs of her child.

She has requested a loan to purchase more body cream, ladies' spray, hair grease, and hand cream to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to build a shop and educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, ladies' spray, hair grease, and hand cream to increase sales for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 49-year-old married woman. She hails from Antequera, Bohol. She has three children ages twenty-five, seventeen, and fifteen years old.

Virginia has been in the buy-and-sell business for twenty years. She sells items like cologne, body sprays (such as Victoria's Secret), and hand sanitizer. She will use this loan to buy additional items like cologne, body spray, and hand sanitizer. 

In the future, Virginia would like to expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cologne, body spray, and hand sanitizer.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has five children ages 15 to 22. All of them attend school. 

For the past five years Martha has been selling rice, pepper, and oil in the local market. She started by getting some money from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and pepper for her business.

In the future she hopes to buy a piece land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Sayda Patricia

texts.es:
Sayda,36 años de edad,  de oficio comerciante, se dedica a vender refrescos y comida, es originaria de  León , casada, tiene tres hijos de 9,12 y 10 años de edad , su esposo trabaja como albañil y soldador. 
Inicio hace tres años con su negocio , vendía solo refrescos naturales de frutas y típicos hecho de maíz y cacao, poco a poco fue añadiendo la venta de comida, tales como enchiladas, tacos de pollo, carne y pollo asado etc. Esto le ayudo a generar ingresos para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y al mismo tiempo generar ingresos por sí misma. 
Está requiriendo el crédito  para comprar frutas, arroz, queso, carne, pollo, verduras, que son parte de la materia prima que utiliza para hacer su comida y refrescos para vender. Su sueño es lograr tener una gran comideria donde sus clientes se sienten a comer con más comodidad y con gusto para disfrutar la comida.
texts.en:
Sayda, 36, a native of León, is a merchant by trade.  She makes a living selling beverages and food.  She's married and has three children, ages 9, 12, and 10.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and welder.

She started her business three years ago.  She used to sell only natural fruit drinks and traditional drinks made of corn and cacao.  Little by little she started selling food: enchiladas, chicken tacos, meat, grilled chicken, etc.  This helped her generate income to help with the household expenses and to earn money for herself at the same time.

She needs the loan to buy fruit, rice, cheese, meat, chicken, and vegetables, which are some of the ingredients she uses to make the dishes and drinks she sells.

Her dream is to be able to have a large restaurant where her customers sit down to eat in greater comfort and enjoy the food with pleasure.

loans.use: to buy fruit, rice, cheese, meat, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Elnura

texts.en:
Elnura is 27 years old, married, and has two children. She is classified as an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She breeds cattle for meat purposes. She also has two milking cows. Her profits consist of sales of cattle as well as fresh yogurt and milk. Her husband is on a pension and helps her to run the business. 

Elnura usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months, and then resells them at a profit from her house. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. She earns 90 AZN a month; this business is only one source of income in her family. Elnura has applied for a loan of 1650 AZN to buy two head of cattle, one milking cow, and fodder.  She is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has already successfully completed two loan cycles.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle, one milking cow, and fodder

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las 12 integrantes del grupo son mujeres trabajadoras, y es por eso que el comité lleva ese nombre.  Ellas desean salir adelante y saben que trabajando podrán hacerlo, es por eso que se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una miembro es la Sra. Natalia, quien hace artesanías en barro y es con esto que subsiste y ayuda a su familia, es un trabajo muy duro, pero ella está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de barro, pinceles y pinturas para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías, y de esa forma seguir ganándose honradamente el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: The 12 members of the group are working women, which is why the group is named "Mujeres Trabajadoras" [Working Women].  They all want to get ahead, and they know that by working they can do it, which is why the came together to help each other.  One group member is Ms. Natalia, who makes pottery by which she supports her family.  It is hard work but she is proud of what she does as it is decent, and above all, honest work. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of clay, brushes and paints to keep doing her crafts and thereby continue to earn an honest living to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy clay, brushes and paints.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 60 year-old married woman and a mother of two grown children from Lila, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than ten years now. 
Emma is asking for a loan to buy additional feeds for the pigs and additional piglets to raise. Emma is optimistic that this loan could make her realize her dream of improving her business. In the future, Emma wants to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for the pigs, additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Fatumata

texts.en:
Fatumata lives in West Point with her friend and her son, who is 6 years old and attending school. She stopped her education in the 8th grade.

Fatumata has a table in the market where she sells cooking oil, vita, palm oil, salt, and onion. She has done this for the past four years. Because she sells what her customers need, she makes a profit. She uses the profit to improve her business and pay the educational expenses of her son. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cooking oil, vita, palm oil, salt, and onion for her business. 

She plans to build house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, vita, palm oil, salt, and onion for her business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael has been operating a retail shop for several years. She is a visionary woman who is very much eager to prosper in life. Thanks to the support she is receiving from Kiva and Yehu, she has been able to increase sales. 

She requests this loan to venture into her cereal selling business. Rachael sells from her home and at the market. She says that she, at times, receives orders from her customers. The challenge is that she does not have means of transport. For this reason, she will use this loan to buy a donkey and a handcart.

loans.use: to buy a donkey and a handcart.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a 34 year old divorced woman who is raising two sons alone.  She is classified as an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives in an IDP settlement. For the past 8 years she has been breeding cattle. After her divorce she was left with two small children and no financial help. She was committed and brave enough not to give up on providing her beloved children with the life they deserve. That`s how she decided to start her cattle business.
	
Gulnara usually buys small calves, raises and fatten them for 5-6 months, and then resells them for a profit in the livestock bazaar. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Gulnara also sells fresh milk and yoghurt to neighbors. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. She has applied for a loan of 1700 AZN to purchase one milking cow, two head of cattle, and fodder. This will be her third loan; she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milking cow, two head of cattle, and fodder

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis en Malambo, municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, se dedica a la venta de cervezas, gaseosas y otros refrescos, actividad que complementa con la rifa de electrodomésticos. El en su condición de casado y padre de 2 hijos en las edades de14 y 19 años, genera sus ingresos a partir de sus dos negocios, actividades que inició desde hace 15  años, con el apoyo de dos de sus familiares, de quienes adquirió el capital inicial, con el cual compró electrodomésticos, posteriormente incluyó refrescos y bebidas y al final agregó las rifas, las cuales vende puerta a puerta. Su meta mas adelante es adquirir un enfriador, para aumentar su potencial de ventas y para poder ahorrar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es que no cuenta con el suficiente capital de trabajo para crecer rápidamente y este es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen, cervezas y refrescos, preparándose así, para la época de fiestas que se avecinan, en la que usualmente sus ventas generan mayores utilidades a su negocio y esto a él lo pone muy contento.
texts.en:
Luis of Malambo, a metropolitan municipality of the city of Barranquilla, works selling beer, soft drinks and other refreshments, and complements that activity with the raffle of household appliances. He is married and father of two children, ages 14 and 19. He earns income from his two businesses, activities that he began 15 years ago, with the support of two of his relatives, from whom he got the initial capital, with which he bought household appliances and later he included the refreshments and soft drinks and finally he added the raffles which he sells door to door.

His goal going forward is to obtain a cooling system to increase his sales potential, and to be able to save and to raise his children. His biggest challenge is that he does not have enough working capital to grow rapidly and this is exactly the reason for asking for a Kiva loan, to buy beer and soft drinks in greater volume, getting ready for the season of festivals that is approaching, because usually his business sales increase and this makes him very happy.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks in greater volume for his business

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es: La Sra. Ramona sigue con la actividad de venta de artesanías las cuales las hace ella misma, realiza hamacas de hilo, collares, manillas cinturones y adornos, muchas veces tiene pedidos. También se dedica a la panadería y los domingos hace patasca cuenta que le fe fue muy bien con el credito, por este motivo esta solicitando otro credito que es para la compra de tela para la realizacion de hamacas, la Sra. Ramona es una mujer trabajadora ya que se dedica a dos actividades para mantener a su familia ya que esta es su unica fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: Ramona continues making artisan crafts which she makes herself. She makes hammocks from fabric, necklaces, belt handles and decorations and has many orders. She also has a bakery and on Sundays she makes patasca (a highly nutritious beef or sheep soup). She says that her credit is going well for her and for this reason she is requesting another loan to buy fabric to make hammocks. Ramona is a very hard working woman who commits to two businesses to take care of her family because they are her only sources of income.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Toda persona piensa que es bueno superarse y salir adelante en algún momento de la vida, por eso esta joven mujer de veintinueve años de edad que vive junto a su grupo familiar en casa propia, ha comenzado un negocio que le ayudara a ganarse un futuro mejor, se dedica a la crianza de pollos, pues es una venta muy rentable que le permite obtener buenas ganancias, ya tiene mucha clientela pues comercia para diferentes alrededores de la localidad donde vive, además la prefieren por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; es una mujer realmente emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora sabe que todo este esfuerzo es una buena forma para alcanzar el éxito y no caer en las actividades ilegales a las que se dedican personas que viven en su comunidad, desea ser buen ejemplo para sus hijos, le gusta su trabajo y lo que hace, desea explotar su energía positiva. En estas ultimas semanas se decidió a realizar una nueva inversión para incrementar el negocio, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pollos y concentrado. Tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de algunos conocidos, se hace totalmente responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez confía en que con oportunidad podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Everyone thinks that it is good to better oneself and to move forward at some point in life, and for that reason this young woman of 29 years of age, who lives with her extended family in her own home, has begun a business that will help her to make a better future.  She works raising chickens, since it is very profitable work that permits her to make good earnings.   Since she has lots of clients, she sells in different parts of the city where she lives.  Her clients prefer her for the quality of her products, her good prices, and her excellent service.  She is an entrepreneurial woman, dedicated to her labor and very hard-working.  She knows that all of this effort is a good way to achieve success and not to fall into illegal activities, such as those that other people in her community dedicate themselves to.  She wants to be a good example for her children.  She likes her work and what she does, and she wants to use her energy positively.  In these last weeks she has been working to achieve a new investment in order to grow her business, but she does not have sufficient capital and for that reason she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will help her to purchase chickens and chicken feed.  She has good references of repayment from some contacts.  She is completely responsible for repaying the loan and at the same time she trusts that the opportunity will give her and her a family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 34 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and she has four children ages 2 to 12.

For the past five years she has been selling palm oil, rice, etc. in the local market. She makes a lot of profits because she sells quality products and she has lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, etc. for her business.

She hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, sugar, biscuits, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said has shown great interest in business. He is a well-known merchant in his area. He has been running a retail shop and a green grocery. He is grateful to Yehu and Kiva for the support he is receiving. Said is happy that he has achieved some of his goals.

He is asking for this loan in order to add stock of consumer products like flour, sugar, and rice, and at the same time open a hardware shop and buy hardware materials.

loans.use: to buy stock of consumer products like flour, sugar, and rice, as well as to buy hardware materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy used clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Los deseos de obtener una mejor vida para ella y sus familiares, hizo que esta mujer reiniciará su vida instalando una venta de pupusas, comida típica y de bajo costo solicitada en el país. Es muy conocida por la zona donde reside ya que es alegre, honesta, sincera y siempre anda brindando ayuda a quien se lo pida, Desde hace un tiempo posee su pequeño puesto de pupusas ubicado en su casa, todos los días ella sale con nuevas ganas para realizar con éxito su trabajo, gracias a Dios se ha hecho de personas que la buscan por las tardes para comprarle y eso la ha sostenido hasta hoy ya que genera ganancias y así siempre lleva el pan de cada día a su casa. Pero ella cree que necesita mejorar y hacer crecer su pupuseria,ya que posee toda la experiencia necsaria para ello, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y así poder comprar insumos básicos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, quesos, entre otros. Ella no se ha dejado vencer por las adversidades y siempre sale adelante, esta segura que pronto saldará la deuda y su negocio mejorará cada día.
texts.en:
The desire to have a better life for herself and her family caused this woman to start anew opening a pupusas (stuffed tortillas) stand, a typical low cost sought after dish in the country. She is well known in the area where she lives as she is cheerful, honest, sincere and she always gives help to those who ask her for it. 

For some time she has had a little pupusas stand located in her house.
