Tita has sustained her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante is married with two children. He is 58 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela.
Dante is a farmer and raises poultry to earn a living. He has been doing this for ten years. He requested a loan to purchase additional poultry to sell.
He has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Dante hopes to save for the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional poultry to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her general store. Nenita has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita is 52 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Novelita has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, milk, and soap. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 35 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 4 años, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente José no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecino, y en algunas ocasiones aprovecha la oportunidad para comer un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones, plato típico de su ciudad.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace varios años, José trabaja brindando servicios de transporte, él cuenta con un pequeño taxi, él cual utiliza como herramienta de trabajo, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana José sale a recorrer las calles de su ciudad en búsqueda de pasajeros, él pude trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de clientes.
José se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño auto, él cual utilizará para seguir brindando servicios de transporte; de esta manera José seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para junto con su familia puedan superarse y lograr su sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and lives in the city of Camaná with his partner and his small four-year-old son. He is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic person, who together with his partner does his very best to help his family get ahead in life.

Unfortunately José was not able to study for a professional career, as from a very young age he had to work to help his parents. But he would have very much liked to have done so. In his free time, he likes to play football with his friends and neighbors, and sometimes takes advantage of the chance to eat a very delicious "chupe de camarones" (Peruvian shrimp chowder), a traditional dish of his city.

On his own initiative, and with a great deal of effort and determination, José has worked for several years providing transportation services. He has a small taxi which he uses as his means of work. Every day, from a very early hour of the morning, José goes out to travel the streets of his city in search of passengers.

He can work around 12 hours a day, and believes it is going well because he knows the areas where he can find the greatest number of customers. 

José is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help offered he will be able to purchase a small car, which he will use to continue offering transportation services. In this way, José will continue working and doing his best, so that he and his family can better themselves, and so that he can achieve his dream of seeing his sons become good professionals.

loans.use: To purchase a small car.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Delia is engaged in a snack vending business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (Philippine Peso) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to be used in redeeming a parcel of coconut land. 
She has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Delia hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To redeem a parcel of coconut land

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is 52 years old and married with nine children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Rafaela has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 46 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Ruth is engaged in a kangkong (a vegetable also known as water spinach) vending business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional kangkong to sell. Ruth has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional kangkong to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a 23,000 PHP (Philippine Peso) loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 56 years old and lives in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is a single mom with one child. Clarita has a retail shop that sells mostly the basic needs of the society. That includes canned goods, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, spices, salt, milk, sugar, soft drinks, juices, and more. She has operated this work for 12 years. This allowed her to earn an income of PHP 3,500 every month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Clarita been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Clarita hopes to sustain the business for much longer, and expand and improve her product offerings to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Buena

texts.en:
This is Buena, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Marulo, a tricycle driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Buena oversees operations of their Tricycle (motorcycle with a side-car) transportation business. They have one Tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Buena dreams to be able to give her family a good life and hopes to give her children a good and quality education through all her hard work with her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy ingredients and utensils for her food production business.

NWTF is relisting Lucia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Lilebeth

texts.en: Lilebeth is 41 years old and lives in Comunal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Lilebeth has a business selling foods as snacks. She earns about 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Lilebeth has a requested loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. She has been a member of PMPC since 2012. In the future, Lilebeth would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her general store business.

Amelia has been in this business for five years. Amelia earns more income from food vending and raising pigs.

Amelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Michelle works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Michelle is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store business.

Michelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocked goods to sell

loans.name: Juan Santos

texts.es:
Juan, necesita capital para invertir en el cultivo de maíz, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de cinco sacos de abono, para mejorar su cultivo al mismo tiempo poder de la cosecha vender a sus clientes una  mejor calidad de  maíz asegurando su venta.
El comenta que gracias al préstamo anterior logro aumentar sus ganancias y ha tenido más capacidad de invertir en granos básicos, sus deseos son aumentar los ingresos económicos y con el crédito de Kiva lo está logrando.
texts.en:
Juan needs capital to invest in his corn crop. He is requesting a new loan so that he can buy five sacks of compost, which will improve his crop. As a result, he can guarantee his sales by harvesting the best quality corn that he can offer to his customers.

Juan says that his previous loan enabled him to increase his earnings. He had more capacity to invest in basic grains. His wish is to improve his income, and this Kiva loan will help him accomplish this goal.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of compost.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ligaya works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ligaya is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and married with 2 children. To make a living, Emma manages a gardening business. Emma has been engaged in her business for four years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC. Emma is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She dreams of business expansion one day.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 52 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. Merlyn is engaged in a fish vending business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase construction materials for kitchen repair and renovation. 

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for kitchen repair and renovation

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Carina works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Carina is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store business.

Carina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned good, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Aida Ester

texts.en:
Aida Ester is married with nine children. She is 54 years old and lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Aida Ester has a jeep for a transportation business. She has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns approximately 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP). 

Aida Ester has been a member of PMPC for two years. She has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her transportation business. In the future, Aida Ester hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her transportation business

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
Hipólita de 53 años, soltera, vio en su hogar conformado por su familia. Ella junto a sus hermanas impulsan un hogar cuya armonía no termina, logrando así culminar la construcción de su casa. Trabajadora y empeñosa realiza actividades agrícolas hace 20 años, posee una variedad de productos de los cuales el cacao fue su elección preferida por ser rentable. Su terreno adquirido en ese entonces se hallaba repleto de maleza, imposible de producirlo y fue así que con mucho esfuerzo ahora incluso es solicitado para alquilarlo a otros agricultores.
Finalizada la temporada de cosecha decidió nuevamente tomar las riendas de su parcela debido a encontrarse delicada de salud , el cual requiere toda la atención del caso en cuando a la inversión que es necesaria para optimizar los resultados, requiere adquirir almácigos así como plantas para injerto y abonos orgánicos indispensables como siempre.
Dentro de sus planes a futuro desea tener una tienda de abarrotes debido a que es consiente que los años acaban con las fuerzas de uno y el campo requiere de mucha destreza, pues el trabajo es lo que ella siempre la motivo y la hace sentir útil. Lleva consigo 16 créditos y se siente contenta por la confianza que MFP invierte en ella, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas. Le encanta su rol dentro de su banco comunal debido a que fue en varias ocasiones miembro de su comité. 
Con los 500 soles realizará la compra de plantas de almácigo de cacao y abono orgánico para optimizar una buena producción en la temporada próxima.
texts.en:
Hipolita is a 53 year old single woman who was raised at home by her family.  Hipolita, along with her sisters, were able to complete the construction of her home.  Hardworking and earnest, she has been making a living in agriculture for the last 20 years.  She has the ability to raise several products but the most profitable is cocoa.  When she acquired her land it was full of weeds and impossible to farm but with great effort she fixed it and now other farmers like to lease her land.  

After the harvest season she decided to analyze her land because it was in poor health.  It requires one's full attention and the correct investments to optimize results.  Now, she requires seedlings, plants, and organic fertilizer more than ever.  

In the future, she wishes to have a small grocery store because she knows as she gets older she will not be strong enough to work on the fields as it requires a lot of work.  This is despite the fact that hard work has always motivated her and made her feel useful.  She now has taken 16 loans and is happy with the trust the MFP has in her.  She promises to be timely with her payments.  She enjoys her role within the communal bank because she was a committee member on several occasions.  With the 500 sols she will purchase cocoa seedbeds and organic fertilizer to optimize next seasons production.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa seedbeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. Joy has been in this business for six years and earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing 21000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Joy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Franz Josef

texts.en: Franz Josef, 25 years old, is a single entrepreneur of Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, with a child. He is earning income from his transport service business. It started almost 3 years ago now, and he earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. To improve the business, he borrowed 20,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Erlinda is married and has four children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a coconut production business. She has had this business for 11 years and earns about 3,600 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for land maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for land maintenance costs.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a loan of 7500 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Rosalie is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy of solar lamp.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Rosalina is married and has 7 children. 

To make a living, Rosalina manages a gardening business where she raises a variety of vegetables. Rosalina been in this business for 7 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Rosalina joined GDMPC. Rosalina is requesting a loan of 11,600 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more animal feed to re-sell in her store.

loans.name: Welsie

texts.en:
Welsie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Welsie is borrowing 4600 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Welsie is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money, as well as helping the environment and reducing the health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana, de 45 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó hace 17 años.  Su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura y ganadería, posee vacas, ovejas, cuyes y gallinas, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues depende de ello las ganancias que obtendría en el momento de la venta. Es por esa razón que procura alimentarlos con pastos naturales y comida balanceada para mejorar la calidad. Paralelo a ese trabajo también, se dedica a la siembra de papa, cebada, habas y talwi (especie de fréjol, que contiene nutrientes curativos). Este último producto lo comercializa en la ciudad de Tarma cada semana. Ahora desea mejorar y aumentar su ganado para mejorar sus ganancias. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, en todo este tiempo demostró ser puntual y responsable sobre todo gusta de pertenecer a su asociación “Virgen del rosario”,  que lo conforman personas solidarias y con espíritu emprendedor. Bibiana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de gallinas y cuyes para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Bibiana, age 45, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her four children and cares for them in a home that she inherited 17 years ago. Her main business activities involve agriculture and livestock breeding. She owns cows, sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens and looks after them with great care. Bibiana depends on the profits she earns from the sale of these animals. For this reason she acquires food, such as natural grasses and balanced animal feed, to improve their quality. At the same time, Bibiana grows potatoes, barley, broad beans, and “talwi” (a type of bean that contains nutrients known for their healing properties). These products are sold weekly in the city of Tarma.

Bibiana now wants to improve her livestock and increase her herds so that she can earn more income. This is her third loan with MFP. Throughout this entire time, she has demonstrated that she is punctual and responsible. Most of all, she enjoys being a member of the “Virgen del Rosario” Communal Bank because her group consists of supportive individuals who possess an enterprising spirit. Bibiana will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs so that she can acquire more livestock.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of frozen treats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge de 54 años muy conocido y querido en su barrio, casado con María, juntos tienen a su hija Riviani, quien a sus 24 años agradece a sus padres por el apoyo que le permite hacer posible desempeñar estudios superiores en una universidad. Jorge y su esposa, lograron construir su casa propia, hoy toda una realidad. Desde hace 25 años desempeño actividades agrícolas en donde dirigía y comercializaba su producto eficiente como es el cacao, de esta manera consiguió acumular dinero con el cual fue posible inagurar un negocio consistente en la preparación de queques y pasteles. Inicialmente para abastecer pedidos que sus amistades y conocidos solicitaban, poco a poco tuvieron que incrementan su repostero. María, su esposa, es la encargada de la preparación directa, teniendo como ingrediente principal las ganas de crecer.
Dentro de sus prioridades esta la compra de ingredientes para la preparación al por mayor, para así obtener descuentos. Ellos sueñan con convertir su negocio en un gran negocio y saben que con esfuerzo y trabajo será posible, así como también el de tener una panadería. Este es su crédito número 12, comprometido como siempre con el cumplimiento de sus cuotas agradece a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por incentivar al cumplimiento y a la vez por el optimismo que imparten. Con los 1,000 soles realizará la compra de ingredientes la por mayor como harina, azúcar, levadura y algunos utensilios para realizar el trabajo con mas fluidez.
texts.en:
Jorge is 54 very well known and loved in his neighborhood, he is married to Maria, together they have a daughter, Riviani, who at 24 years old thanks her parents for the support that allowed her to get through her university studies.  Jorge and his wife were able to build a house that now is a reality. For 25 years he worked in agriculture where he produced and sold products such as cacao, this way he was able to save money and start a baking business.  At the beginning they filled orders from friends and acquaintances, but little by little they had to increase production. Maria, his wife is in charge of prep and her main ingredient is the wish to grow.

One of his priorities is the purchase of ingredients to produce for wholesale and this way get discounts.  They dream to turn their business into a great business and they know that with effort and work it will be possible, just like having a bakery is.  This is their 12th loan, committed as always to make their repayments he thanks his teammates from the community bank for promoting responsibility and for being optimistic.  With the 1,000 Peruvian New Soles he will buy ingredients at wholesale such as flowe, sugar, yeast and tools to perform his work faster.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and some tools to work faster.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Amani prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her brother.

Amani is a 27-year-old married female from Al Russeifeh in Jordan. she has a child and requests a 600 JOD loan to pay for her home improvement expenses and purchase some furniture. In the future, she would like to have her own personal project.

Since Amani is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvement expenses

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Aminata, a businesswoman in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. A native of Gbenseh in Koidu, Aminata is 40 years old and is married to a trader. The couple has 3 children who are attending primary school. Aminata has been a businesswoman for many years selling dishes, buckets, spoons, plates, etc. She has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Leones in order to buy additional dishes, buckets, spoons, plates, etc. in bulk.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware and utensils to resell

loans.name: C7876 Korandebe Ii Group

texts.en:
Valerie is 34 years old and married with three children between the ages of eight and 15 years old. Valerie is the leader of the group called C7876 Korandebe Ii. Her business is well-known for selling rice and has been in operation eight years. Valerie works from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except Saturday's. In the photo, she is the third person from the left side. 

Valerie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more fertilizer for her rice agriculture so she may resale large quantities of rice. With the profits, Valerie will be able to reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice agriculture.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married and has five children. Joseph is 22 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. To earn a living, Joseph has a vulcanizing shop. He has had this business for one year. Each month he earns approximately 5000. He has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase equipment for his motorcycle repair business. 

Joseph has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his vulcanizing shop.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is from Taraka, Jimenez. She is 31 years old and is married. Jenelyn operates a specialized retail store selling SIM packs and pre-paid cell phone credits. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Jenelyn joined GDMPC. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase cell phone products and credits to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cell phone products and credits to resell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is from Panay Diot, Tudela. She is 44 years old. Evangeline is married and has seven children. To make a living, Evangeline has owned and operated a vegetable-gardening business for the past two years. She earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2011, Evangeline joined GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Chinnie

texts.en:
Chinnie is 34 years old, is married and has five children.  With two children in school, Chinnie works very hard to provide for them.

Chinnie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Chinnie has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar and soap.

In the future Chinnie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to resell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with 4 children. She is 42 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marilyn sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 3 months. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business. Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Guingona, Ozamis City. She owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Lydia has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC since 2008. In the future, her plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and to build a chicken house

loans.name: Nieva

texts.en: Nieva, age 37, cultivates bananas for a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She's been engaged in this work for 10 years and earns a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 from GDMPC in order to obtain farm fertilization. Nieva been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She hopes to buy and own a motorcycle in the future so as to minimize delivery costs and to increase her income.

loans.use: to obtain farm fertilization

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is married with two children. She is 35 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.

Arlene is engaged in buying and selling to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy dried fish and longaniza (sausage) for her buying and selling business.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 8 years.  In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and longaniza for her buying and selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Ms. Bolormaa is a 37-year-old who lives with her mother and daughter in a small house in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar. She has been operating a grocery store since 2008. She has a lot of experience in this business and has many customers. Her mother is retired. 

She borrowed a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan from the XacBank branch and repaid the loan according to the installment plan responsibly. Her mother said, "Her business has just stabilized and it is a first step to make our lives stable and better."

Her house where she, her mother and daughter live has a broken rooftop and snow and rain come in the house from the broken roof. She is requesting 4,000,000 MNT to repair the broken roof in order to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter. Her standard of living is normal.

loans.use: To repair her broken roof in order to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Pelagia

texts.en:
Pelagia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

NWTF is presenting Pelagia's business profile for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla is 32 years old and married with two children.

Myla works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Myla has been in this business for 11 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Myla aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business. She has been in this business for seven years now and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Pulodjon

texts.ru: Пулодчону 19 лет. Он молодой, энергичный и приятный молодой человек. Пулодчон учится на 2 курсе Таджикском Государственном Университете в факультете Таможенное дело. Среди однокурсников Пулодчон имеет хороший статус и уважение. Он очень любит читать зарубежную литературу. В свободное время он занимается спортом. Особенно он играет футбол. Пулодчонн еще не женился и живет с родителями. Зарплата его родителей не хватает оплатить за учебу в университете и поэтому он запрашивает займ. Он надеется на вашу доброту. Давайте, ему поможем стать хорошим  специалистом и таким образом осуществить его заветную мечту!
texts.en:
Pulodjon is an pleasant, energetic 19-year-old young man. He is studying trade and customs affairs for the second year at Tadjik State University, where he has good standing and respect among his classmates. He loves to read foreign literature and he plays sports in his free time. He especially likes to play soccer. He is still single and living with his parents. 

His parents' income is not enough to cover his university tuition, so, he is asking for a loan. Let's help him become a good specialist and likewise realize his dreams! He is hoping for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his education at the university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mirabel

texts.en:
Mirabel is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mirabel has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items like noodles, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Mirabel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like noodles, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is a married woman from Antequera, Bohol. She has one child aged 21. She has been in the food-vending business for eight years. She sells snack foods like buchi, made of flour, sugar, yeast, and coco meat. She also sells ice candy with different flavors like mango, avocado and pineapple. She plans to use the loan to buy more flour, sugar, and yeast. 

In the future, Timotea would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures to support her family.

loans.use: to buy items like flour, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Karen Astrid

texts.es:
Karen es una mujer de 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Karen no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, desde hace 4 años Karen trabaja brindando servicios de alquiler de cochera, ella cuenta con un pequeño local, el cual alquila a pequeños comerciantes para que guarden sus carritos sangucheros, carretillas y otros;adicionalmente ella tbn vende dulces y queques en su mismo local, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, ella cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Karen se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su cochera, ya que desea pintarlo y cambiar el portón de este local; de esta manera Karen espera darle mayor presencia para captar a mas clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda iniciar sus estudios profesionales con el deseo de poder conseguir un mejor trabajo, el cual le ayude a lograr su sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación y calidad de vida a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Karen, 26, lives in the city of Cañete in the Imperial District with her husband and two small children, who she loves and who are her main motivation in life.  She is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who makes every effort, alongside her husband, to provide for the family.  Unfortunately, Karen was unable to get any professional training because she has had to work to help her parents.  In her free time she enjoys spending time with the family.

With much dedication and hard work, Karen has been renting garage services for four years.  She has a small building that she rents to small business owners so they can park their traveling food stalls, carts and other vehicles.  She also sells sweets and pancakes at her location.  Every day she starts work early in the morning.  She believes business is doing so well because she is kind to her customers.

Karen is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to them she can renovate her garage which is in need of paint and a new door.  Karen hopes to be able to increase her presence and attract more customers this way, allowing her to keep working and make every effort to continue her education.  This will allow her to get a better job, so she can giver her children a good education and quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate her garage.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
This is Marlyn. She previously accessed a 26,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marlyn dreams to expand her business and provide a good future for her children. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 58 years old and married with one kid.

Helen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Helen has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from frozen food and e-loading.

Helen aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Union Por El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú! La Sra. Linda  es integrante de la alcancía comunal “ Unión por el Progreso”, un grupo conformado por 8 socias que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.

Linda se dedica a la venta de abarrotes es decir arroz, fideos, leche, galletas ,  el negocio esta ubicado en su casa y es propio, Linda inicia este negocio hace un año, con el tiempo cuenta con clientes fidelizados y su negocio sigue creciendo.

Linda ha solicitado el préstamo  para comprar mercaderia arroz, fideos, leche, galletas, para implementar su negocio . Su sueño es un día ser mayorista.

Linda es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, Linda ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos, se ha comprado un terreno y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida. Linda está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a Edaprospo y a Kiva.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú!  Linda is a member of the communal bank "Unión por el Progreso", which is comprised of eight members who are involved in different business activities.

Linda sells groceries such as rice, noodles, milk and cookies and runs her business out of her own home.  She started a year ago and now has loyal customers and a growing business.

Linda has requested a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk and cookies for her store.  Her dream is to become a wholesale dealer one day.

Linda has a common-law husband and a son.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication, Linda has been able to increase her income and has bought land, and is giving her family a better quality of life.  Linda is very happy with this loan and grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Fatima Lorena

texts.es: Fátima, es una joven de 28 años, originaria dela comunidad El tamarindo en las afueras de Leon, es comerciante, se dedica atender una pulpería. Inicio a los 21 años, cuando su mama enfermo ella se tuvo que hacer cargo del negocio y del hogar. La ventaja que posee su pulpería es que está ubicada en un lugar turístico y la afluencia de gente es constante. Está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar un estante donde pueda colocar, más productos pues las condiciones en que esta son  humildes y desea superarse cada día, surtir más su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fátima, 28, is from the community of El Tamarindo on the outskirts of Leon.  She is a merchant and runs a grocery store.  She started her business at age 21 when her mother became ill and she had to take over the business and the household.  The advantage her store has is that it is located in a tourist area with a constant flow of visitors.  

She is requesting a loan to buy shelving so she can stock more products.  The conditions she lives in are humble and she wants to improve her lifestye daily, increase her store inventory and renovate her home.

loans.use: To buy shelving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel de 31 años una madre con una gran empatía, es madre de su pequeña Halsy de 3 años, junto a  Yuri su pareja trabajan con el máximo esmero para darle a su pequeña lo que ellos no tuvieron de niños.
Una de las cosas que lograron fue la construcción de su casa propia, cuyo costo fue el esfuerzo de muchos años de trabajo. Con varias opciones en mente decidió con el apoyo de su pareja, tener su fuente de soda cuyo expendio de jugo de frutas y pasteles le permitió ganar muchos clientes desde hace 1 año, pues eso la hizo sentir  mas motivada en su trabajo añadiendo la oportunidad de iniciar con el abastecimiento de sándwiches y bebidas a grandes instituciones atraídos por el buen sabor que ella es capaz de ofrecer en sus preparaciones.
Le agrada mucho saber que puede servir a mucha gente con su trabajo ya que es un de las cosas que ella siempre busco de un negocio. Es por ello que tiene en mente ampliarlo a futuro. 
En ocasiones al recepcionar pedidos en cantidades considerables no cuenta con capital inmediato para la compra de ingredientes ya que estos son solicitados con tan solo un día de anticipación, arriesgando en ocasiones a perder el pedido pues son una de las oportunidades que más ingresos le genera. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP con lo cual agradece la confianza brindada y se siente muy comprometida con el pago de sus cuotas. Agradece  así mismo a sus compañeros de su banco comunal por la acogida que tuvo desde su ingreso ya que considera trabajar con microcréditos.
Con los 1,000 soles obtenidos podrá cumplir sin complicaciones con todos los pedidos que lleguen a su fuente de soda ya a que comprará ingredientes al por mayor para la preparación de sándwiches y bebidas; como frutas, carne, embutidos y bebidas gasificadas.
texts.en:
Maribel, 31, is a mother with a lot of emphathy.  She has a three-year-old daughter, Halsy, and she and her partner, Yuri, work hard to give their little girl everything they were unable to have as youngsters.

One of the things they have accomplished is to build their own house, which cost them many years of hard work.  With several options in mind, and with the help of her partner, she decided to establish a soda fountain and sell fruit juice and pastry.  In a year's time she was able to attract many customers and became more motivated in her work and started selling sandwiches and sodas to large institutions who were attracted to her tasty products.

She enjoys the fact that she can serve many people through her work, because it is something she always wanted to do.  Therefore, she would like to expand in the future.

Sometimes when she receives large orders and does not have the immediate capital to buy ingredients (which are ordered only one day in advance), she runs the risk of losing the order, and these are the ones that generate the most income.  This is her second loan through MFP and she is grateful for the confidence shown in her.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  

She is also grateful to the members of her communal bank for how they welcomed her into the group.  With the 1,000 PEN loans she will be able to fill all the orders she receives at her soda fountain, and will be able to buy wholesale ingredients to make sandwiches and drinks, such as fruit, meat, sausage and sodas.

loans.use: To buy fruit, meat, sausage and sodas.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items such as bread, noodles and other groceries. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as bread, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is from Malibangcao, Clarin. She is 34 years old. Rosemarie is married and has four children. To make a living, she manages the planting and harvesting of corn for sale. She's been engaged in her business for seven years and earns PHP 5,400 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosemarie joined GDMPC. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to buy fertilizer for corn. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for corn.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. She previously accessed a PHP 8,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 8,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia dreams to live a happy life by the help of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Ejemplo de mujer, independiente es Victoria de 48 años cuyo esfuerzo y empeño dirigen un solo objetivo que son sus padres, logró desde hace 5 años completar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble a favor de sus progenitores quienes muy agradecidos se sienten orgullosos de poseer una hija tan empeñosa. Al hacerse posible la adquisición de parcelas para la producción no dudo sacarle el máximo provecho para el bienestar familiar desde hace 5 años, iniciándose independientemente hasta hoy con uno de los productos de mayor demanda, el cacao.
Desde entonces gracias a los préstamos que obtiene por parte de MFP le es posible la contrata de jornaleros así como la compra de abonos con el cual inicio extrayendo productos de calidad comercial motivándola a incrementar sus plantaciones en poco tiempo.
Ahora mas que nunca continua desempeñándose con más impulso pues uno de sus objetivos es la de inagurar una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio para poder así ocupar a sus padres. Dentro de sus prioridades al iniciarse la temporada de plantación y mantenimiento es el de adquirir almácigos de cacao así como abono orgánicos cuyo uso es indispensable para obtener la calidad requerida por los acopiadores. Su séptimo  crédito es un compromiso mas para ella según cuenta, pues siempre agradecida por la oportunidad de pertenecer como socia a MFP le permite desempeñarse con mayor confianza. Le agrada mucho desempeñarse también como socia de su banco comunal debido a que sus compañeros son muy optimistas. 
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementará su capital de trabajo que le permitirá adquirir abono orgánico así como plantas de  almácigos de cacao y contratar jornaleros para el desyerbo de sus parcelas optimizando su producción.
texts.en: Victoria is an exemplary independent 48-year-old woman whose effort and hard work is done solely with her parents in mind. Five years ago she was able to complete construction on her home with quality materials thanks to her parents, who feel very proud to have such a hardworking daughter. Acquiring the land made it possible to produce crops and provide for her family's well-being for the past five years. She started on her own with one of the products in highest demand, cocoa. Since then, thanks to the loans through Kiva partner MFP, she has been able to hire workers as well as purchase fertilizer, with which she started growing commercial-grade products, thus motivating her to expand her plantation. Now she wants more than anything to continue building upon that momentum, since one of her goals is to open a convenience store in her home to keep her parents busy. Among her priorities to start the planting season is to acquire some cocoa plants as well as organic fertilizer, which is indispensable in order to reach the necessary quality for the cocoa buyers. Her seventh loan means more than she can say, and she is always grateful for the opportunity to be a member of MFP, which allows her to work hard with more confidence. She also is very grateful to belong to her community bank since all of her fellow members are very optimistic. With the loan, she plans to purchase organic fertilizer and cocoa plants, as well as hire workers to rid her land of weeds to optimize production.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa plants and organic fertilizer, and hire workers.

loans.name: Juan Misael

texts.es:
Juan, es un humilde comerciante el cual se dedica a vender leche, casado, padre de tres hijos los cuales viven independiente. Su negocio lo empezó con una bicicleta un balde de leche. La escasez de trabajo se volvió aguda y necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia, busco la ayuda de su papa y este le sugirió que vendiera leche y así fue que tomo su bicicleta y salió a las calles de los barrios más populares de la ciudad de León a vender leche. Su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y aporta al hogar.  
Requiere el financiamiento para comprar leche al por mayor. Ya que tiene demanda de este producto pero no ha podido abastecer a sus clientes por falta de capital. Su idea es ir aumentando la venta de leche a mas barrios comprar un vehículo para utilizarlo en repartir leche a domicilio. Ayudarle a su esposa a salir adelante con el negocio de pulpería.
texts.en: Juan is a humble merchant who makes a living selling milk. He is married and has three children, who are grown up and live on their own. He started his business with a bicycle and a bucket of milk. Unemployment was intense and he needed a way to make headway for his family, so he turned to his father, who suggested that he sell milk. So he took his bike and went through the streets in the most populated neighborhoods in the city of León selling milk. His wife runs a small convenience store out of their home and helps with household expenses. He is requesting the loan to purchase milk at wholesale, since he has demand for the product but has not been able to keep it in stock for his customers because of a lack of capital. His idea is to keep increasing his milk sales by going to more neighborhoods and purchasing a vehicle to make his deliveries. He helps his wife make headway with the convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en: Constancia is married with three children. She is 53 years-old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Constancia sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase food to cook her snacks to sell/retail. Constancia has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Constancia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for snacks to cook to sell/retail.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte
